article:

Phew. This is a ridiculous one.
The incident happened a few years ago in science class. The class was practicing using and handling microscopes; we were midway into the activity when I noticed a girl staring intently at the wall.
 
“What’s wrong?” I asked.
 
She turned to me, pointing to the diagram of the human organ system. She looked throughly confused.
 
“But… but… I thought that the human heart was 
actually shaped like a heart…”
Here’s another one from the same girl. We were in Social Studies class, learning about the geographical features of Asia. We were told that Mount Everest was located in the Himalayan region (Nepal and Tibet).
 
The girl quickly raised her hand in protest.
 
“No, 
Mount Everest must be in America. 
It is.”
 
The entire class was in hysterics.
Olivia out!
 
*Edit* // Something else recently happened. Today — in science — a boy raised his hand and blatantly stated that “The USA is a state, like New York is…” .
 
The world we live in…

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
The first time I visited the USA, from South Africa, I went to a party in Michigan. Everyone I met was pretty impressed that I had come all the way from Africa (I kept mentioning I was from South Africa, because no-one comes from Africa, but rather countries on the continent. )
It was the middle of June and a pretty warm afternoon, so we took a swim in a lake. A pretty girl I had made friends with that day looked at me, waist deep in that cool water, and I’ll never forget the question she asked:
 
“Do you have lakes in Africa?”
 
That was probably the most ignorant thing I’ve ever heard anyone say,

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
As others say, you don’t need many.
 
There are 4 basic movements:
Lower body push
 (squat)
I do mostly low bar squats, but you can squat high bar if you prefer. I also do paused (2 count) squats as a lighter variant. Front squat, overhead squat, leg press, split squat, lunge are all usable variants as well.
Lower body pull
 (deadlift)
I do conventional deadlifts. I also do snatch-grip deadlift as a lighter variant and rack pull as a heavier one. You can also do Romanian DL, clean or snatch grip high pull or Olympic lift (clean,snatch) variants.

As others say, you don’t need many.
 
There are 4 basic movements:
Lower body push
 (squat)
I do mostly low bar squats, but you can squat high bar if you prefer. I also do paused (2 count) squats as a lighter variant. Front squat, overhead squat, leg press, split squat, lunge are all usable variants as well.
Lower body pull
 (deadlift)
I do conventional deadlifts. I also do snatch-grip deadlift as a lighter variant and rack pull as a heavier one. You can also do Romanian DL, clean or snatch grip high pull or Olympic lift (clean,snatch) variants.
Upper body push
 (press)
I do mostly close grip bench press, with or without a pause. You can also do overhead press, push press, incline BP, dips or pushups for variation.
Upper body pull
 (row)
I do mostly weighted parallel-grip chinups, but there are many types of row (barbell or dumbbell) and pullup that can be used.
You should do one of each per workout although you can alternate lower body push and pull (squats and deadlifts) if you prefer. You don’t need more than two variants at most for each movement.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My story is not about ignorance, but a lack of common sense. Years ago I was working for an American company, in Malaysia. In January of one year, a whole bunch of us got to go to San Francisco for the company’s annual sales pep talk :-D. We all stayed at a really nice hotel, and one evening, after all the rah-rah for the day was over, we all decided to have a drink before heading back to the hotel. As I was the designated driver I didn’t want anything to drink, so just asked for a glass of warm water. Soon enough, everyone else got their drinks, but I didn’t get mine. Instead the waitress (wh
Continue Reading
My story is not about ignorance, but a lack of common sense. Years ago I was working for an American company, in Malaysia. In January of one year, a whole bunch of us got to go to San Francisco for the company’s annual sales pep talk :-D. We all stayed at a really nice hotel, and one evening, after all the rah-rah for the day was over, we all decided to have a drink before heading back to the hotel. As I was the designated driver I didn’t want anything to drink, so just asked for a glass of warm water. Soon enough, everyone else got their drinks, but I didn’t get mine. Instead the waitress (who was really very sweet) came over and said, very apologetically, “I’m sorry Ma’am, we have HOT water, and we have COLD water, but we don’t have any WARM water”.
 
We all looked at each other, not sure if she was serious… then realised that, yes, she was serious! So I said, “Can you take a glass, half fill it with HOT water, then top it up with COLD water?” And she says “Oh WOW, that is so clever!!.. and, Yes, I got my glass of warm water.
 
It was a real face-palm moment!

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
Any muscle if worked out daily would not give you results for few basic identified facts:
Soreness of muscle.
Incomplete muscle recovery.
Lesser strength and endurance.
Tiredness.
Joints pain.
So the same goes for abs too. You can perform abs exercise on alternate days and side abs in between days.
 
Note: eating right is very important for muscle recovery and tissue repairing.
 
Hope you find it helpful.
 
#
HappyWorkout.

article:

Ignorance, according to the dictionary, means “lack of knowledge or information”

Ignorant of what?
 
Ignorance, according to the dictionary, means “lack of knowledge or information”
 
To me, it means someone who ignores knowledge or information. There is no lack, it is a conscious decision to ignore it. That is ignorance. The information is not lacking. It is there. The ignorant people simply ignore it.
 
I have met and lived with and grown up with many people ignorant of many things. My bible school (grade k~12) was based on ignorance. My church was based on ignorance. All of my friends were ignorant.
 
Not knowing the year of the Declaration of Independence is not “ignorant”. - it is simply “who cares, what does it matter?” because really, it does not matter. How many states in the US? too easy, but that is not ignorance, because it does not really matter much.
 
Ignorance is when you ignore facts in front of your face that do matter.
 
About 1/3 of my facebook friends are ignorant when it comes to racial issues, gun violence issues, health care, women’s rights, climate change, Trump etc.
 
I know too many to even start listing them, and I would not list them on a public site like this.

First thing first, I ain't writing this to convey how poor I am or anything. The sole reason I am writing this is to make you believe in hardwork. Moreover we are happy and I believe there's always a bright thing behind everything !
 
So the story starts from the day I gained my conscience. And It was the day I understood that we have to move; leave our house.
 
The landlord doesn't want 5 member living under the same roof for the cost of 3. They believed it would fill the septic tank faster than a 3 member family would.
 
It was the day, I saw the first quarrel of my life. We were forced to leave only because my parents had 3 kids. And believe me, no parent would take that and that was the reason the very next day we left that place.
 
The new place as per I remember was a typical small kitchen, modified so that a high '
khaat
' (bed, but not exactly bed) accommodate. Strings tied around the wall for our clothes to rest. And wooden suit-case under the same high '
khaat
'.
 
Oh ! Did I not tell you ? My father is a carpenter and when you make something cheap why make one? So, he made the bed as well the suit-case.
 
But this new place wasn't that bad as it may seem because our neighbours were kind enough to let me watch TV (that was when I discovered Shaktiman and Ben 10 and Beyblade) and the kitchen where we lived belonged to one storey house. We were free to roam anywhere during the daytime but not at night.
 
Fast-forward to 10–12 years later, and here I am typing this under a asbestos 2 room house; that we own. I have a mango tree behind our house and a small verandah at the front. We own a t.v. running fta channels and have access to internet as well (obviously not due to jio effect). Thanks to my parents, all of us three could comprehend fluently in English .
 
And the most important, no one can ever force us to leave.
 
So, it's upto you to judge if I'm poor or not . But when a guy wearing a costly t-shirt than yours and bad ranks gets a better seat, you know you are atleast not poor.
 
Subbhakhair ~

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Many. I’ll let the readers take a pick:
I have a friend from Spain with light brown hair and gray eyes. When she tells people where she’s from, a common response is: “How can you be Spanish? You’re white!!”
Back in high school, a teacher could not convince a student that India is one of the largest countries in the world, and that it is basically the size of the western US. The kid kept arguing, and insisting that “India is the size of Texas”. The teacher just decided to move on to the next topic.
An electrical engineer once thought that red-sand deserts are the result of the “sun burning them”. 
Continue Reading
Many. I’ll let the readers take a pick:
I have a friend from Spain with light brown hair and gray eyes. When she tells people where she’s from, a common response is: “How can you be Spanish? You’re white!!”
Back in high school, a teacher could not convince a student that India is one of the largest countries in the world, and that it is basically the size of the western US. The kid kept arguing, and insisting that “India is the size of Texas”. The teacher just decided to move on to the next topic.
An electrical engineer once thought that red-sand deserts are the result of the “sun burning them”. Having a geology degree, I patiently explained to her how and why that is not the reason.
The subject of Ireland came up with one guy, and I told him how a long time ago, the Irish spoke Gaelic before Ireland became largely English-speaking, and is taught in schools and that Ireland has been trying to revive. He kept stubbornly insisting that no, that’s not true —- they just have a “very heavy accent”
The most recent one was yesterday: I’m out in Hawaii at the moment, and I get a call from the dentist, telling me that I need to get a filling soon. OK, fair. But I tell them I’m in Hawaii (for work, not vacation) and that I need to wait until I get back about 3 weeks from now. She answers ‘OK, we’ll see you when you get back to the U.S.’

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
The home workout should target strength and endurance in the muscles that you use daily. This is the most basic requirement.
 
The next is to improve your cardiovascular capacity. The result will be you are working at a lower heart rate than before. Less stress on the heart.
 
Then you should also work on agility and balance. This will regain back the spring in your step as you grow old and move around flat footed. You are also less likely to fall and hurt yourself.
 
The two main muscle groups used daily are the lower body and the upper body pulling action. The third group is the upper body pushing ac
Continue Reading
The home workout should target strength and endurance in the muscles that you use daily. This is the most basic requirement.
 
The next is to improve your cardiovascular capacity. The result will be you are working at a lower heart rate than before. Less stress on the heart.
 
Then you should also work on agility and balance. This will regain back the spring in your step as you grow old and move around flat footed. You are also less likely to fall and hurt yourself.
 
The two main muscle groups used daily are the lower body and the upper body pulling action. The third group is the upper body pushing action. Very seldom used but you can also do the workout if you want to.
 
Forget all the various types of workouts you can do. Just stick to the simplest that you can groove in and do in your sleep.
 
The body weight squat is sufficient for the lower body strength. There is also the need to increase stair climbing ability and endurance. A low stool is a good point to start. Then onto a sturdy chair as you improve. Do this in conjunction with the body squat. It prepares the body when you switch from walking and then climbing stairs.
 
Lower back extensions will cover the upper body pulling action. The most basic is bending forward while trying to touch the toes and then straightening up. It sounds simple but it is NOT. The SPINE must be kept in the neutral position ALL the time. It forces the lower back muscles to do most of the work and thus you will get the proper adaptation. A more advanced and more strength adaptation workout is in the image below.
Pull ups will build arm and related muscles.
 
Push ups are enough for the pushing group of muscles.
 
The agility, balance and cardiovascular part is taken care of by doing rope skipping or rope jumping, whatever the term. For the average person, it is equivalent to running for the same length of time in terms of energy usage if you are looking at weight loss as well.
 
The only problem you will face is that it is NOT easy at first. If you target say 30 minutes, I doubt you can even do the two leg version for 10 minutes. Your legs will start to burn. That is the alert to stop. Just do the one leg after the other version at slow speed. Stop and rest when you are alerted. Then continue until you reach the 30 minutes. As you improve, increase speed and slowly build up until you can do the two leg version continously for your target duration. Rope skipping, especially on two legs involve the toes, the ankles and calves mainly. The thigh muscle do only a bit of work. Hardly any stress on the knees as the angle of bend is small. So no fear of knee injury.
 
Not much more to add except to point out a few things. The rope skipping will most probably bring you up to around 80% of max. This is because you are working at just below the leg burning stage. That level is enough for a fairly high level of cardiovascular adaptation if done for a long enough duration and period. How you schedule your workouts and whether to mix them together in a single session, I leave to you.

title: Is a full body workout two or three times a week as effective as a split routine working out 5 or 6 days a week? How do I get the best results possible with the least time invested?
article:
Effectiveness is relative to your goal.
 
For a beginner, a full body routine 2–3 times a week is sufficient. They have little training experience, need to practice the same exercises more frequently and don’t need a huge training volume.
 
An experience bodybuilder would need 5–6 training sessions per week, split in to different muscle groups. The reason for splitting the muscle groups up is that is allows each group to be targeted with more volume.
 
An inexperienced trainee might only need 8–10 sets targeting their legs to stimulate muscle growth, due to lack of training experience.
 
The bodybuilder m
Continue Reading
Effectiveness is relative to your goal.
 
For a beginner, a full body routine 2–3 times a week is sufficient. They have little training experience, need to practice the same exercises more frequently and don’t need a huge training volume.
 
An experience bodybuilder would need 5–6 training sessions per week, split in to different muscle groups. The reason for splitting the muscle groups up is that is allows each group to be targeted with more volume.
 
An inexperienced trainee might only need 8–10 sets targeting their legs to stimulate muscle growth, due to lack of training experience.
 
The bodybuilder might need 30–40+ sets for their legs, to stimulate any muscle growth and will also need longer to recovery. Therefore, one sessions per week with huge volume is sufficient.
 
The only benefit of a beginner training 5–6 times per week would be to increase energy expenditure for a fat loss goal. However, this can be managed via diet or additional lower-intensity exercise (such as walking).
 
I hope that helps.

Canadian coins have animals on the back and a picture of Queen Elizabeth on the front . I was taking a train to Dallas with my daughter years ago because she was ill and needed to be seen by a specific doctor who was doing child trials on a new drug not yet available in Canada. By the time we got to Arkansas we, and most others on the train were very bored, and my daughter was sleeping as was normal for a sick child. To amuse some children who had gotten on the train in Arkansas, I showed then my Canadian coins and promised them each one if they could name the animals Two of them recognized the beaver and arctic hare, although she called it that white bunny where Santa lives (she was about 6!) and took the coins back to show their mother who asked me where they were from and who was the lady on the front. When I told her that I was Canadian and that that was the queen,she exclaimed very loudy “Oh my goodness! Them people over in Canadia have a gay cross dresser guy on all their coins! How awful for them!” Then she looked me right in the face and yells. “Do y’all know what christianity is or are you one of those crazy cult people?” when I explained who the queen was and told her why were on that train, she again shouted loudly. “Do y’all not have doctors in Canadia?”
 
All I can say is that I’m really glad hat she did not home school her kids .
 
That same trip I also had someone ask where I was from in Canada . When I said Ottawa,they stated “oh,that suburb of Montreal,” the got all upset when I said “yeah, like Washington is a suburb of New York”

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Well I think it really depends on your goals and body. Firstly, you can’t train every day, you should give your body a rest to maximize your performance and recover. So you can train full body, but do it 3–4 times a week that would be enough. Here’s what I think:
 
Pros:
Doing 3–4 days is enough so you don’t have to make time everyday to work out. I mean if you do 3 days for legs, 3 days for arms then you will need to workout almost everyday and for many people it’s not very convenient.
You have time to recover. You know even when you do arms exercise sometimes you get little bit of leg soreness! A
Continue Reading
Well I think it really depends on your goals and body. Firstly, you can’t train every day, you should give your body a rest to maximize your performance and recover. So you can train full body, but do it 3–4 times a week that would be enough. Here’s what I think:
 
Pros:
Doing 3–4 days is enough so you don’t have to make time everyday to work out. I mean if you do 3 days for legs, 3 days for arms then you will need to workout almost everyday and for many people it’s not very convenient.
You have time to recover. You know even when you do arms exercise sometimes you get little bit of leg soreness! As it is not always possible to isolate everything. So if you are working out every day on a different area you might have still feel too sore to do your best.
Cons:
If you want to see change on your shoulders or arms as soon as possible then this isn’t the best choice. As the results will come slowly.
It usually takes longer so if you are very busy it would be hard to commit to it. It might be more suitable for you to do 20 minutes every day on specific areas.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Some
 people (not everyone!) get a 
very
 good response to training frequency. Basically meaning that doing muscle groups more times a week can give them fantastic results. You should at least try it and see what happens.
 
I think the potential drawback to full body every day is if your body isn't used to the frequency, and you're sore all over all the time. Working out then might be a bit too painful, you might not squeeze out much juice, you might not want to go to the gym.
 
But for intermediate training and above (i.e. when you don't get super sore and you won't hurt yourself doing a high-frequenc
Continue Reading
Some
 people (not everyone!) get a 
very
 good response to training frequency. Basically meaning that doing muscle groups more times a week can give them fantastic results. You should at least try it and see what happens.
 
I think the potential drawback to full body every day is if your body isn't used to the frequency, and you're sore all over all the time. Working out then might be a bit too painful, you might not squeeze out much juice, you might not want to go to the gym.
 
But for intermediate training and above (i.e. when you don't get super sore and you won't hurt yourself doing a high-frequency program), you can experiment with increasing frequency per muscle group and seeing if you're one of the higher responders. I think this school of thought is becoming more popular in contrast to many bro-split programs.

I'm not rich by monetary standards. I was born and raised in Quiapo, Manila, mind you where we live is not the best part of the city. My mother is a “mananahi” or what you call dressmaker in the west. My father when he was still alive was a carpenter, mason or what they call a manual laborer. They use to be farmers, but they did not own the land that they tilled. We did not own a house in Manila nor did we own a TV set ’til I was 8 years old. My sister is a domestic helper in Singapore.
 
I got lucky, I was able to get a chance to be with people who are smart and was nice enough to share what they know in spite of my economic strata.
 
I live, work and study in the US now. But I am far from being rich. My mother is still in the Philippines, along with my nephews. I have Internet, it's not free, I pay for it from the salary I get. I use it for classes as well.
 
I'm not even sure why I am answering a question like this one because it appears more like a troll question than a sincere one.
 
Yes there are poor people in Quora. I am one of them. I go into Quora whenever it's my break. Why are we here? I guess we just want to know more and share the things we know.

I don’t like indulging the dumb American stereotype (and you do 
not
 have to look long or hard to find thick people where I’m from) but…
 
When I had recently arrived in the country and was buying a car, I took a test drive. While talking to the sales guy in the car, he asked me where I was from. Knowing that saying “Britain” sometimes confuses people here, and not really being in the mood for a long explanation of the difference between country and nation and why part of the island of Ireland isn’t part of the country of Ireland, etc., I said “England”.
 
“Oh, your English is really good!”
 
I think I almost crashed the car.
 
After a couple of minutes I established that, yes, he really did think we spoke another language, although he didn’t know what it might be. I assured him that we actually speak English and, in fact, that was how the language had got its name.

A bit about me. I'm a 2nd generation Korean American. Born in and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area but currently residing in Beijing, China.
 
So a few months ago, I'm boarding a direct flight from Beijing to San Francisco. A nice elderly lady from Florida sits next to me. Our flight was delayed a good two hours on the tarmac (eventually canceled because of a mechanical issue.. thanks United!).
 
She was quite pleasant and we conversed about many things including me growing up in San Francisco, my undergrad and grad school experience, working in Silicon Valley, raising a family, etc. She told me a bit about herself as well. All in all it was great 
UNTIL…
 
After two hours of conversing.. .she says
 
“Your English is very good. It's much better than our tour guide here in China!”
 
I just said “thanks” and proceeded to give myself a (facepalm). She said it with such a smile as if she was so proud of me I really couldn't say anything else.

“Cheap” is relative. So is “poor.” Many of the world’s people cannot afford internet access. Many afford internet access by sacrificing something else. Many Quora users may access the internet from computers at public libraries or similar places where access is free or very cheap. I suggest you don’t insult these people by suggesting that internet access is cheap. It is anything but cheap.

title: What happens if you workout every day?
article:
You don't have to take whatever you may have heard or read about that seriously. You are unable to improve ONLY if you do EXACTLY THE SAME thing when you workout. So if you keep on changing resistance levels, speed of your reps, number of sets, your body will continue to react accordingly to the stimulus. You only plateau if your body has no more incentive to adapt. Otherwise how can those fantastic body builders get their physique? I am very sure that they do squats all the time, week after week. Isn't that the same as what you are asking? So keep on doing what you are doing and increase resi

You don't have to take whatever you may have heard or read about that seriously. You are unable to improve ONLY if you do EXACTLY THE SAME thing when you workout. So if you keep on changing resistance levels, speed of your reps, number of sets, your body will continue to react accordingly to the stimulus. You only plateau if your body has no more incentive to adapt. Otherwise how can those fantastic body builders get their physique? I am very sure that they do squats all the time, week after week. Isn't that the same as what you are asking? So keep on doing what you are doing and increase resistance as required while changing rep tempo, no of reps and other aspects of your exercise to keep your body guessing. That's all you need to do to prevent any plateauing.

I am from Panama, but lived for years in the US. Over the years I lived in the us (10+) I have both made some great friends, and met some ignorant people.
 
Apart from the traditional questions (“Is Panama in Africa?”, “Does the Panama Canal have anything to do with Panama?”, “Do you have [cars/TV/internet/etc] in Panama?”, etc.), the one that took the cake was a lady back in the 90’s attending at Nordstrom. She heard me and my roommate (an Ecuadorian) talking in Spanish…
 
“Where are you from?”she asked
 
“Panama” I replied.
 
“Oh, Panama… Is it true that everyone lives in a palm tree down there?” she said
 
“Sure. Of course it is true” I answered sarcastically, while giving my roommate a WTF look.
 
“But, HOW do you get up there” she continued…
 
I looked at her now totally perplexed and answered the first thing that popped into my mind…
 
“ELEVATORS!” I said
 
By the way, for those of you who cannot picture Panama City (the one in Central America, not the one in Florida), here is a picture of the city I was born and raised in:
As you can see, we do not exactly live atop palm trees…
 
:-)

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
Before workout-
Pre-Workout meal- 
It’s necessary to have something before you’re heading to the gym, you can’t push your limits on an empty stomach. If it’s a heavy meal then let your food digest first, wait for 3–4 hours before you start lifting and if it’s just a small snack then an hour is enough.
Warmup 
- Get your blood flowing a little before you hop on a bench and start pressing. Warmup your muscles before you start lifting heavy, create a mind-muscle connection and then start your actual workout.
After workout-
Post-Workout meal
- If there was a pre workout meal, then there has to be a post 
Continue Reading
Before workout-
Pre-Workout meal- 
It’s necessary to have something before you’re heading to the gym, you can’t push your limits on an empty stomach. If it’s a heavy meal then let your food digest first, wait for 3–4 hours before you start lifting and if it’s just a small snack then an hour is enough.
Warmup 
- Get your blood flowing a little before you hop on a bench and start pressing. Warmup your muscles before you start lifting heavy, create a mind-muscle connection and then start your actual workout.
After workout-
Post-Workout meal
- If there was a pre workout meal, then there has to be a post workout meal. Why? Because you just hammered those muscles, your body is depleted of energy and that’s why this meal is the most important meal of the day. 
Yes, the most important meal of the day. 
I see folks in my gym who smoke cigarettes and consume a packet of chips after lifting weights. Please, don’t do that.
Water
 - Water is your body's principal chemical component and makes up about 60 percent of your body weight. It’s important to stay hydrated through out the day, I drink a liter before my workout then a liter during my workout and then a liter after my workout. If you’re drinking enough water then your body will stop holding on to it. Hence, weight loss.
Sleep - 
We sleep in cycles.
 
And our body recovers during deep sleep.
 
So, longer sleep results in longer deep sleep and longer deep sleep results in better recovery.
 
NO RECOVERY = NO GAINS
Supplements
 - I believe it’s really hard to get all necessary nutrients from our regular diets, some people can do that, I agree, but not me. And there are so many of them, choose a supplement according to your goals. I’m currently taking Omega 3, Multi-vitamins and Creatine Monohydrate.
Let The Gains Begin!

title: What is the best workout for me?
article:
There are some awesome answers here. Very wise words. I'd like to add something very simple though. My time as a personal trainer taught me this.
The best workout in the world. Is the one you wake up excited to do.
I could write you the most scientifically accurate, peer reviewed, emperical workout using years of research and experience. But if your not excited to do it. You wont.
I dont care what it is; gym, rock climbing, running, dine and dashing, 6 days a week chest.
 
Whatever you wake up in the morning excited to do. You will end up doing. And doing it everyday.

My ignorant Americans weren't actually in the States but I love this story.
 
July 4; Verona, Italy. Met a couple from Massachusetts. He was a teacher (!) and she was an administrator.
 
I wished them a happy Independence Day and he went off about how disappointed they are by the lack of celebrations (in Italy) for July 4.
 
I'm Canadian, so I bit my tongue and politely told them that I'd been with a group of Americans on July 1 and they'd made a big deal out of wishing me a happy Canada Day and they'd even bought me a specialty dessert in Siena to celebrate.
 
He looked at me like I was crazy, shrugged, and said he had no idea when that was.
 
So, you expect another country, on another continent, to celebrate YOUR independence day but you can't even be polite enough to pretend to care about your next door neighbours independence day.
 
I just smiled politely to his face and have laughed at his ignorance for years.

This, unfortunately, was more than one but all with the same issue. For several summers I worked in a museum gift shop in a small town in Canada, near the US border. It gets hot in Southern Alberta in the summer, this particular day around 35 degrees which I believe is somewhere around 90 degrees Fahrenheit. There is a very large particular religious contingent in Southern Alberta, so most stores aren’t open on Sunday. We were the first stop in Canada for a large tour group from the Southeastern U.S. who had all flown to Great Falls, Montana and picked up a large bus. Well, about 15 of them came in in sweaters, and long pants, socks and shoes/boots and started buying up our very overpriced shorts and t-shirts and flip flops in relatively large quantities. They all assumed it would be snowing and freezing cold in southern Canada- in August! We’re farther south than than mos northern parts of Maine, but okay! Even if you don’ t know a lot about Canada….wouldn’t you at least look up what to wear while there? Our national animal is a beaver, not a polar bear! Even the farthest inhabited areas are still quite warm in summer!

1. buy a membership
2. have the proper equipment, such as shoes, towel and water
3. Know your goals, what area of the body do you want to train.
4. warm up the area of the body you are working out.
5. Concentrate on 3-4 exercises per body area and 6-8 reps for building strength and mass  and 12-15 reps for more tone
6. Take rest days
7. start with 3 days per week if you are working out the same body part each time
8. if you want to do 5 days a week then workout a major muscle group (chest) with a smaller muscle group (arms), workout different muscle groups each day so the previous muscle group has time to recover.
9. stay hydrated
10. eat food as soon as you can after working out to boost recovery.
11. stay motivated and good luck.

title: Which 3 exercises would give me the most complete workout?
article:
Two essential movements of life..
 
Lift and Carry !!
DeadLift:
With deadlifting, you don't need fancy techniques like drop sets, super sets, or rest/pauses. Stick with simple training and reps of 1-10.
Deadlifting is the base upon which all real back strength is built. There's not a more 
true-to-life

The deadlift's simplicity is also the reason it's so effective. It stresses every major muscle group in your posterior chain, but none more so than your back. It works your back from the base of your erectors to the top of your traps and ev
Continue Reading
Two essential movements of life..
 
Lift and Carry !!
DeadLift:
With deadlifting, you don't need fancy techniques like drop sets, super sets, or rest/pauses. Stick with simple training and reps of 1-10.
Deadlifting is the base upon which all real back strength is built. There's not a more 
true-to-life
 exercise. You bend over and pick up something heavy. That's it.
The deadlift's simplicity is also the reason it's so effective. It stresses every major muscle group in your posterior chain, but none more so than your back. It works your back from the base of your erectors to the top of your traps and everything in between.
Squat:
Just as we should eat the foods our bodies were designed to eat, we should move our bodies the way they were meant to move and impose the stressors they were meant to bear. That means squatting, and squatting often. Our hips flex, knees bend, and ankles dorsiflex so that we can rest comfortably in a squat position..
Squat is a complicated movement that forces the body’s parts to work and grow stronger together as a 
single unit
Farmer’s walk:
The Farmer's Walk activates nearly every muscle group. The core braces and stabilizes the entire body. Grip strength in the hands, wrists and forearms is a necessity. The upper back works to keep the shoulders and chest from sagging. The legs obviously propel the walk, and the cardiovascular system is engaged throughout the entirety of the movement. As a result, your entire body is put to work burning fat and creating lean muscle stores.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My brother.
 
Last night, I was talking to him about earth science. Now, my brother is in 6th grade so he recently learned about the supercontinent Pangaea.
 
He then asked me about why dinosaurs were extinct. As I patiently explained the cause of their extinction, my brother interrupted and said,
 
"I thought they only lived in America."
 
I laughed and told him that they lived throughout the supercontinent. He disagreed and claimed that dinosaur bones had been only found in the US.
 
Although I was internally amused, I showed him some websites which disproved his claims.

Hint: Strength Training is medicine!
 
I have no idea what works for you as a new beginner. I started my journey with the usual doses of cardio and working out with the silly gym machines. It was dull and boring. I didn’t care for it.
 
Later, to jazz it up, I added some stationary bike workouts conducted in a group setting mixed with music and led by a coach. That was fun and relatively impactful, building a bit of stamina and energy. The progress was slow. Within six months of doing these things, I noticed minimal benefits because I had no idea how to manage my diet and sleep habits. That wasn't the whole story. I also didn't have a solid workout plan, didn't know anything about planning correctly, eating, and sleeping accordingly. It was a waste of time. What I mean is that I failed miserably.
 
Eventually, after doing lots of research, I started a strength training plan that entails barbell deadlifts, squats, and bench, all multi-joint workouts. Pow!. It was a firework. I fell in love with the whole concept of barbell workouts. It is an athletic workout; it empowers, builds character, and produces unique physical sturdiness and athleticism beyond anything I experienced. Working with a coach, I learned different variants of these lifts and made progress safely. Two years later, I arrived. I gained everything I planned and then some. Thank You Strength Training! -hooray.
 
So, I advocate the same system to others, the ones that are courageous and adventurous and willing to achieve difficult things in life.
 
If you are an absolute beginner, you can start with a plan of daily walking and gradually adding sessions of strength training.
 
That's how I began my Powerlifting experience.
 
Resistance training is medicine: effects of strength training on health - PubMed
 
Disclaimer:
 
Mansour’s disclaimer:
 
Don't do anything stupid and get hurt lifting big weights after reading some of my answers. It would make us both quite unhappy. Consult a 
Medical Doctor
, a 
Strength Training coach
, and 
common-sense specialist
 before doing anything you may read in some of my answers.
 
Medical Considerations

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
My first son-in-law.
 
A week before his first Christmas with my daughter, he told me that his job had given him a Christmas bonus, which he had just discovered in his checking account. He received only paper checks from his employer.
 
I explained to him that the extra money in his account was due to checks which had been written but not yet cleared, but he insisted that he'd been given a bonus, which he proceeded to spend.
 
Still shaking my head...

Have you looked at some of the questions that get asked by my “fellow countrymen” on Quora?
 
But moving on…
 
When I was in the Navy (circa 1967–1971) I heard two bubbas discussing the national anthem. One of them said something like, “It were writ by Stephen H. Foster, during the Civil war!”. As both these guys outranked me by at least three stripes and a couple of dozen hashmarks between them, I said nothing. I was a fly on the wall.
 
The other guy said: “Yer dumber ’n sh*t! Everybody knows what the Star Spangled Banner was writ by Francis Scott Key!”.
 
I was dumbfounded. He actually had gotten it right! I was almost a little proud of him.
 
Then he went on: “…And it weren’t in no Civil War, ya dumbsh*t! He wrote during the war of 1812!”
 
I was doubly dumbfounded! He was already two for two! This guy was on a roll!
 
Then he capped it off to really put the other guy in his place:
 
“…
When the Yankees was attackin’ the Alamo!
”.
 
True story.

article:

Continue Reading
That’s a great question.
 
First of all, 10 kg isn’t light. You can achieve just about anything with the weight of your own body. But, sometimes it’s hard without equipment and dumbbells are a great choice. They are versatile and even portable.
 
So, let’s get into it.
 
In order to shorten this answer and not repeat myself, I won’t write about basic bodyweight training. Here’s an answer where I go in depth about this:
 
Lazar Nikolic's answer to What is the best way to build muscles at home?
 
First of all, if you don’t have a
 pull-up bar
, these dumbbells might come in handy – curl variations (for biceps), dumbbell rows (narrow for lats, wider for rear delts) etc. But I highly suggest you try to save up for a pull-up bar, or at least find one in your neighborhood. Or use something else that’s strong enough for you to hold onto. Pull-ups are one of the staples of bodyweight training.
 
This leads us to another point from the previous answer: muscles you can’t easily target without equipment. 
Calves
, for example, are used to the weight of your body, but using 20 kg of dumbbells as a resistance just might create initial overload. Don’t try to exercise your 
middle delts
 with these, though. I’m almost certain you won’t be able to handle so much weight in a side lateral raise.
 
But, the beauty of dumbbells is this – you can make any exercise harder or easier with these. Let’s take this paragraph from the linked answer:
Mix push-ups and dips for the chest, front shoulders and triceps
Mix pull-ups and chin-ups for lats, biceps, rear delts and the upper back
Mix variations of leg raises, planks and crunches for abs and obliques
Do lower back extensions for the lower back (spinal erectors)
Mix hip thrusts and glute bridges for the gluteus
Mix squats and lunges for quads
You can put a dumbbell (or both) in a backpack and create more tension on 
dips
, 
push-ups 
or a 
plank
. You can use one or both in 
squats
 and 
lunges
 easily. You can make both 
hip thrusts
 and 
glute bridges
 harder with dumbbell(s). And you can hold one or both while doing 
crunches 
or even hold one of them between legs in 
pull-ups
 and
 leg raises
 when you get strong enough.
 
But making things harder is in perspective, first you need to create a strong base and develop proper form if you intend on adding weight. That’s where we start looking at things from a different perspective.
 
If 
push-ups
 are too hard, use dumbbells to do a 
dumbbell bench press
. You don’t even need a bench, lay on the floor.
 
Handstand push-ups
 are one of the best shoulder building exercises. But that’s way too hard, even for more experienced individuals. So, how to get there? Well, you can go through push-up progressions, but you can also strengthen these muscles doing 
dumbbell overhead press
. In the beginning, use only one dumbbell and switch to both when you develop adequate strength. Just make sure you are familiar with proper form.
 
In the beginning, you probably won’t be able to 
curl 
10 kg effectively either. So, again – use only one dumbbell. If that’s the case, that is.
 
So, in short – if you pair your two dumbbells with bodyweight training, you can definitely build more than enough muscle.
 
I suggest you head off to 
Athlean-X
 YouTube channel and learn proper form of any exercise you want to do. You can also find great insight on 
Calisthenic Movement
 and
 FitnessFAQs
 YouTube channels.
 
Learn new variations, both easier and harder, if you want to have a good, stable base for future training. Develop your whole body and stretch, so you don’t injure yourself.
 
Don’t chase numbers, do your absolute best on every exercise and you’ll have results. Just make sure that you can safely do anything you set your mind to. Again – 
study proper form in detail before attempting anything
.
 
Good luck!
 
EDIT
: In some other answers, people said that these dumbbells will eventually get too light for you. That certainly is true. But, with good 
bodyweight variations
, you can mitigate this “problem”. You can also change the way you move them in space –
 slow down
, do 
one and a half rep
 style training, do 
21's technique
 and more. Yes, expanding your equipment inventory would be beneficial, but that’s so far ahead of you that you don’t have to worry about that now. Cheers!

As a beginner, the best 
home workouts
 we can start with is a warm-up, whether it's for yoga or gym. Nowadays, we are at home and can't go to the gym, so let us start with a yoga set.
 
We can start with basics like stretching the upper and lower body. Below I am mentioning some of the names that can give you a certain idea of which home workout you can do as a beginner.
 
1. Neck Stretch:
 
It is best for the people who work on desktop 24/7. This might help you give a gentle stretch on both the side. You can try this position in both ways ( standing, sitting - I feel it will better if we do it in the standing pose).
2. Knee up:
 
This exercise strengthens up the core, and it's good for your abdominal muscle. As a beginner, you can start with 3 or 5 sets for a day which will gradually help you burn your fat.
3. Superman Pose:
 
It is also called as Viparita Shalabhasana in yoga. This pose helps you strengthen shoulders, arms and glutes. It also improves your blood circulation and stamina.
4. Padvritasana [Leg Circles]
 
If you are looking for losing some weight or shaping yourself, this is the asana that helps in reducing fats from your hips and thighs.
 
It's effortless to do it. You have to lie down on your back, and your arm should be resting alongside, so, in this, there are two ways of doing it:
 
Lift your right side make a circle ten or 15 times same goes with the left side.
 
Lift both of your legs and try to rotate them ten times in clock and anticlockwise direction.
5. Jumping Jack:
 
It's a part of a cardio workout, and as a beginner, you should certainly try it because it increases your energy level, stamina burns your belly, tight fat. You don't need to do it for 20 or 30 mins; you can do 2 or 3 sets in a day.
These are the few home workouts you can try doing it.
 
Yes, we all understand, we are at home so it's natural to be stressed out and get irritated, for that you must try these home workouts which can keep your mind and body calm

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
New York City, May 1998.
 
I am queuing at the buffet of a hotel in Times Square. Things seem to be slow, and the gentleman in his sixties who is standing just beside me starts a conversation. In a very polite way, with soft and charming voice, he is complaining about the service. He soon understands that I am a foreigner and feels the urge to apologize for the situation, where the staff of the hotel has clearly underestimated the flow of the clients.
 
"In America, we like when things are properly set up in advance and made on purpose for a specific event. Consider that we have an idiomatic express
Continue Reading
New York City, May 1998.
 
I am queuing at the buffet of a hotel in Times Square. Things seem to be slow, and the gentleman in his sixties who is standing just beside me starts a conversation. In a very polite way, with soft and charming voice, he is complaining about the service. He soon understands that I am a foreigner and feels the urge to apologize for the situation, where the staff of the hotel has clearly underestimated the flow of the clients.
 
"In America, we like when things are properly set up in advance and made on purpose for a specific event. Consider that we have an idiomatic expression in English for saying that."
 
"Really? And what is it?"
 
"We say 'ad hoc'."
 
I think for a moment whether to bite my tongue or not, but I can't resist.
 
"Well...that's Latin, I am afraid."
 
"This is unlikely! Never heard a Latino use that expression.”
 
At this point, yes, I decided to bite my tongue.
 
Edit:
 
In this story I’m referring to that kind of benign ignorance that makes you chuckle and that you find everywhere in the world. I’m sure that in another part of the globe there’s someone who’s laughing aloud for something that I said or did in the past (or I will say or do in the future).
 
Then there is the ignorance that scares me. Unfortunately, you can find this in all the places too.
 
I think they are so different kinds of ignorance, they would deserve to be defined with different words.
 
The gentleman in this story was a very nice person. I wish I could have spent more time with him.

Working in the States for about 6 weeks on a project I was invited to a BBQ at a colleagues house on a weekend. I’d offered to bring some beers so stopped at a store on the way. The conversation with “Stacey” at the till went something like this…
 
S - I’m sorry sir, but I’m going to need to see some ID for this purchase.
 
Me - Not a problem… and pulled my UK driving licence out.
 
S perusing said ID - I don’t think I can accept this as it’s not American.
 
Me - No problem… and pulled out my passport
 
S looking at my passport - I can’t accept this either as it’s not American and it’s not an ID.
 
Me - That’s my passport, it’s literally an internationally recognised form of identification.
 
S - But it’s not an American ID.
 
Me - That’s because I’m not an American.
 
S - I can’t accept these ID’s because they’re not American, and I can’t sell you alcohol without ID
 
Me tapping my passport - You do understand that your government allowed me into this country with this identity document… look, can you call a manager as we’re getting nowhere
 
Now the manager appears
 
Mgr - Is there a problem Stacey.
 
S - Yes. This man has no ID to buy this beer
 
Me - I do have ID, just Stacey here doesn’t quite grasp the concept of non-American ones.
 
Mgr looks at them both - Stacey, it’s fine, you can take either of these.
 
S - BUT THEY’RE NOT AMEEEEEEERICAN!!!
 
Mgr - Stacey… Just ring it up. I’m really sorry Sir.
 
S - You speak reeeeeally good English by the way.
 
Me - I’m sorry what?
 
S - Your English is excellent… for someone from the UK.
 
I just looked at the manager and raised my eyebrows… he simply shook his head and wished me a good day.

article:
Over the course of my travels I've met a handful of American and other Western folk alike and all of them seem to have common misconceptions that blissfully scream stupidity. Here are a few snippets from the numerous conversations I've had with them. (In the Q&A format)
 
Q. Your from India? I heard you guys have cows walking around everywhere?
 
A. Cows do walk on the street now and then but in most big cities this is a rare sight.
Q. Your from India, you speak 'Indian' right?

Continue Reading
Over the course of my travels I've met a handful of American and other Western folk alike and all of them seem to have common misconceptions that blissfully scream stupidity. Here are a few snippets from the numerous conversations I've had with them. (In the Q&A format)
 
Q. Your from India? I heard you guys have cows walking around everywhere?
 
A. Cows do walk on the street now and then but in most big cities this is a rare sight.
Q. Your from India, you speak 'Indian' right?
 
A. ‘Facepalm moment’, oh man. A person from India is known as Indian. Similar to how an American is from America. In India we have a host of languages that we speak and I speak Kannada in particular.
Q. Do you guys have snake charmers and fortune tellers everywhere?
 
A. Sure, we're one big folk lore of a country! It's just a notion move on.
Q. Why do you guys use water and not toilet paper? Isn't it disgusting?
 
A. I think we believe in cleaning up our mess completely and not keep things hanging until further action is taken.
Q. You're from Indian, can you speak English?
 
A. Yes Einstein, does it look like I'm talking to you in Swahili.
It's awfully amusing to see the notions that many westerners have about India. I sometimes don't know if most these notions are due to ignorance or stupidity. I convince myself that it is ignorance but every now and then I'm proven wrong.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I have not personally experienced any such incident, but I am going to give an example that most people might remember.
 
In 2014, when Indian-American Nina Davuluri won the Miss America title, Twitter exploded with tweets like “Arab wins America” or “More like Miss Terrorist” or “How the f*** a foreigner won Miss America? She’s an Arab, for God’s sake” and more. Let us understand the facts here that:
Miss. Davuluri is of Indian origin, so clearly she’s not an Arab.
She is an American national. The basic requirement of participating in Miss America is the contestant should be a citizen of America.

DataGrip is a powerful SQL tool, but whether it’s the best for you will depend on your tasks.
 
If you only work with one database, then that database’s native client may be the best option, especially if admin features are important to you.
 
DataGrip’s code assistance is top-notch, but as a side effect it can be slow for very large databases. It is, however, getting faster all the time, as speed is a priority for the product development team.
 
DataGrip isn’t free, but there is 
a one-month free trial
 so you can determine how well it meets your needs.

Once, my stepmom was giving some kids a ride to some sort of sport (my sister does a lot of them). One of the girls told me she had read the Percy Jackson series, and she had enjoyed them. Since I too enjoyed that series, I immediately asked her about it. This isn’t exact wording, but I hope it captures the topic well enough.
 
“Who is your favorite character?”
 
“I’m not sure, but 
DEFINITELY
 not Nico.” Nico being my favorite character, I was shocked and a bit surprised to hear this, but I was willing to give her the benefit of the doubt. Perhaps she disagreed with his standoffish behavior, or his questionable decisions early on in the series.
 
“Why?”
 
“He likes Percy.”
 
“So?”
 
“Percy’s a guy.”
 
“I know.”
 
“But that’s just so weird! I mean, boys like girls! Why would he like a guy?”
 
“That’s who he likes. Some people do, you know.”
 
“What? Really?”
 
“Actually, around ten percent of people like the same gender.”
 
“That’s gross. It’s wrong!” I’m bisexual, but I can handle a reasonable amount of homophobia. I generally don’t try to change people’s opinions on one of their core beliefs, and since she wasn’t saying Nico should die or anything, I did the reasonable thing. I tried to start a discussion on it.
 
“Why?”
 
“People are supposed to reproduce.” This was the typical beginning to a decent argument I’ve heard before, so I expected her to start saying that. Instead, she said, “You can’t have babies unless you’re married.” 
Uhhh… What?!
 
“Actually, people who are just dating can have a kid too.” I was also going to explain that gay marriage is now legal.
 
“No they can’t. It’s physically not possible unless you get married.”
 
“You mean when a couple are… 
together
?”
 
“No, getting married, like a wedding.” That is to say, the celebration where women typically wear white.
 
“What?”
 
“You know what, this conversation is pointless. You don’t get it. We should just stop.”
 
She later proceeded to go on a rant about how we didn’t need plastic or any synthetic materials to maintain our present society the way it is. She also related a series of pretty questionable laws of physics (that is to say, completely and obviously false). In addition, she told us that scientists today had the technology to “magically change the atoms in metal into some sort of big atom that makes up a car that can move on its own” without requiring any sort of energy to move it (or wheels, for that matter). I believe she also declared butter did not contain oil. Yes, she did indeed say “magically”.
 
Perhaps her parents simply have not told her these things yet. She had clearly gone through puberty, though, so I don’t know why.
 
I don’t meet a lot of ignorant people, as I generally am surrounded by my rather intelligent, philosophical friends, so maybe she isn’t very ignorant. She’s just the most ignorant one I know.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
In Germany at university, in the early 1990s, we had a guy who became a German citizen. His parents were from Turkey (Türkiye), but he was born in Germany, spoke perfect German, and – if I may say so – didn’t look “Turkish”. If you didn’t know his background you would think he is German.
 
When somebody in Germany becomes a citizen, that person is considered basically 100% or very close to 100% German. You are part of “the team”.
 
Or so we thought. Along came another guy, an American student, Peter (name changed), who insisted that not matter what he will always consider him Turkish, and he will al
Continue Reading
In Germany at university, in the early 1990s, we had a guy who became a German citizen. His parents were from Turkey (Türkiye), but he was born in Germany, spoke perfect German, and – if I may say so – didn’t look “Turkish”. If you didn’t know his background you would think he is German.
 
When somebody in Germany becomes a citizen, that person is considered basically 100% or very close to 100% German. You are part of “the team”.
 
Or so we thought. Along came another guy, an American student, Peter (name changed), who insisted that not matter what he will always consider him Turkish, and he will always be a Turk for him. Peter even went out of his way to say this to his face. Something along the lines: you are not and never will be German because you are Turkish and for me you will always be a Turk.
 
When we tried to talk to Peter, he insisted on being right and got very agitated. There was no way to change his mind.

title: How should my weekly gym workout be?
article:
It entirely depends on what you're trying to accomplish.
 
Are you trying to lose weight, or are you trying to build muscle ? Both at the same time is going to be extremely difficult if you only go to the gym once per week.
 
Other answers say high weight, low reps for once a week, but not only is this geared more towards a mass build than a weight loss/tone, but also can be unnecessarily dangerous to the joints of you're only doing it once a week.
 
I would recommend a treadmill or eliptical set before lifting. Then high reps with low weight when you lift, or a warm-up set on every specific exercise b
Continue Reading
It entirely depends on what you're trying to accomplish.
 
Are you trying to lose weight, or are you trying to build muscle ? Both at the same time is going to be extremely difficult if you only go to the gym once per week.
 
Other answers say high weight, low reps for once a week, but not only is this geared more towards a mass build than a weight loss/tone, but also can be unnecessarily dangerous to the joints of you're only doing it once a week.
 
I would recommend a treadmill or eliptical set before lifting. Then high reps with low weight when you lift, or a warm-up set on every specific exercise before you do your actual sets, followed with descending weight sets.
 
And remember that diet is key — if you don't keep a proper diet, the gym will not help you with anything you're trying to accomplish.

Excitement is an emotion, and many ignorant people use their emotions when making decisions, not their minds. Because of this, ignorant people gather in groups of likeminded people to fight for their causes—and it only takes one person to be their spokesperson. So I am teaching in Poland, and one of my fellow ‘Native speakers’ teachers at an international school, is from America. She was a nice person, but had a blind side regarding Trump. Trump wanted to be friends with Putin, and I said coming up to his re-election that under orange face, the United States had abdicated its traditional leadership role in global alliances and left much of the rest of the world open. No NO, NO! No American wants to go back to Obama care, we cant afford it! I tried to suggest that a war in Europe or Taiwan will cost you far more? She was still singing his praises when the day of the January 6 attack on the Capitol: “You don’t concede when there’s theft involved.”… She quit - went home - when over 1/2 her class was full of Ukrainian and Belarusian refugees and she could not control the group. My parting word were don’t worry - your be able to vote Donald back in in 2024, if he is not behind bars… lol

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Well, I never actually met them, but I sat on the other side of the place aisle for 14 hours which was enough for me.
 
In January 2002, I flew from Sydney to Los Angeles. I was flying Qantas Business Class, which was when Qantas flew 747s. Upstairs were their primary business-class cabins. There were about 20 of us in the cabin.
 
This extremely large American couple, probably in their 60s, and by large, I mean he would have been 200kg (31.5 stone), and she would have been 150kg (24 stone), sat on the other side of the aisle from me. They had to fly business class since it would have been physicall
Continue Reading
Well, I never actually met them, but I sat on the other side of the place aisle for 14 hours which was enough for me.
 
In January 2002, I flew from Sydney to Los Angeles. I was flying Qantas Business Class, which was when Qantas flew 747s. Upstairs were their primary business-class cabins. There were about 20 of us in the cabin.
 
This extremely large American couple, probably in their 60s, and by large, I mean he would have been 200kg (31.5 stone), and she would have been 150kg (24 stone), sat on the other side of the aisle from me. They had to fly business class since it would have been physically impossible for them to sit in an Economy class seat!
 
They were so large that they both needed extender seat belts, the first and only time I have ever seen these being used. And that's when it started. The husband declared at the top of his voice, “I’m an American, I’m from Texas, I don't need a seat belt.” The crew tried to explain to them that it was the law, and eventually, they calmed down and put them on—I think they had had a few drinks in the lounge beforehand.
 
We eventually took off, and the meal service came. They couldn't use the fold tables since their stomachs were in the way (also a first for me to see). Special trays had to be used, which they perched on their stomachs (gee, I wish phones had cameras back then!).
 
Anyway, they proceeded to drink more and more, and their voices became louder and louder. Every once in a while, if they didn't like something, they would say “I'm an American,” and bearing in mind, this was Jan 2002, just four months after 9/11, they would also say things like, “America is going to kick some Taliban arse!”. I am sure you all get the picture.
 
Everyone else in the cabin was just rolling their eyes and laughing at them - I said to one of the flight attendants, “Any chance you could open the side door and kick them out?” She just laughed and said, “I wish”! We were at 30,000 feet over the Pacific at the time!
 
I have been to the US more times than I can count, and I have never ever met anyone who comes close to these two thoroughly obnoxious/ignorant people!

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
Nope. 
 
tldr; 
 
Neither is really better or worse overall if you can't stick with it. 
 
The best time to workout is entirely up to what works for you. Pick a time that you can do the most consistently, then worry about 'optimizing' if at all.
I'm going to address a few fallacies I've skimmed over so far, then I'll get to the meat of my answer in terms of what really matters.
 
1 - Working out doesn't 'jump-start' your metabolism. Exercise certainly 
adds
 
additional energy output
 as it relates to metabolism (See: 
What are the best ways to recover or improve my metabolism?
) but that doesn't mean 'jumpstart
Continue Reading
Nope. 
 
tldr; 
 
Neither is really better or worse overall if you can't stick with it. 
 
The best time to workout is entirely up to what works for you. Pick a time that you can do the most consistently, then worry about 'optimizing' if at all.
I'm going to address a few fallacies I've skimmed over so far, then I'll get to the meat of my answer in terms of what really matters.
 
1 - Working out doesn't 'jump-start' your metabolism. Exercise certainly 
adds
 
additional energy output
 as it relates to metabolism (See: 
What are the best ways to recover or improve my metabolism?
) but that doesn't mean 'jumpstart.' Being awake in the first place burns more energy, eating a meal burns energy, but they don't 'jumpstart' metabolism either. They just contribute to daily energy expenditure.
 
The same amount and type of exercise done at a different part of the day will essentially have the same effect on your metabolism overall.
 
It does generally improve mood and energy though. Especially at moderate intensities (aerobic exercise for instance).
 
2 - Not everybody 'feels' energized 
all day
 from exercising in the morning (
I certainly don't
), the boost it provides to energy/mood is usually only as short as a few hours. It also takes roughly 3 hours for body temperature to increase to highly functioning levels anyway, so you might get an endorphin boost until temperature levels hit peak, that carries you through to the early afternoon (
so a good portion of the day
) but most people will still experience a lull in early afternoon (1-2 PM-ish), despite exercising in the morning. 
 
You might actually do better exercising just before lull that to reduce it's impact. And for other reasons I'll get to below...
 
3 - Exercise does increase memory retention and cognitive function, but these benefits are not limited to a window of 4-10 hours. Exercising in the morning doesn't increase this benefit according to any research I'm familiar with. Furthermore, you wouldn't be wasting those benefits even if there was such a window as most long-term memory retention and cognitive improvement benefits happen during sleep. 
 
Read 
Spark: The Revolutionary New Science of Exercise and the Brain
, but I don't remember it indicating such a window, nor any of the research I read following it up; If anything, closer to exercise would still be better for the several studies done on how subjects perform better on tests done very soon after exercise. The effects on the brain overall however, appear to stick quite well no matter the time.
 
4 - If you work early in the morning, then it might absolutely be a problem to get up 30-60 minutes before that. I used to start my work day at 6 AM, up at five, technically when I should be in my deepest sleep, now I'm supposed to get up 30-60 before that? So 4-4:30...which means getting to bed at 8-8:30 PM to get eight hours of sleep, which is generally just after when circadian rhythm makes most people the most alert. 
 
For anyone other than true larks (small percentage of the population), this is a very daunting task. Sure if you start your work day at 9 AM, getting up at 7 to do a quick workout before work might not be so tough and it might often be better for a lot of folks to get it out of the way before their day gets away from them. Mental fatigue from many decisions throughout the day can make it tough to get to the gym after work for A LOT of people, if it isn't already a routine.
 
However, all of this doesn't make it the best or worst time to train, it totally depends on you the person. Your existing routines, your natural circadian rhythm bias (some are larks, some are night owls, most are in between), your work schedule, your family schedule, etc...etc...
For more details on how to discover something that works for you then I highly recommend you read these (disclaimer: My Blog...):
 
Help! When Should I Train? (Part I) - Skill Based Fitness
 
 
Help! When Should I Train? (Part II) - Skill Based Fitness
 
First, generally speaking consistency matters more than anything else. So if you can make yourself more consistent by getting up in the morning and get it out of the way, then sure that would make working out in the morning better...
for you...
 
This still wouldn't make it better for everyone else.
 
That's first and foremost the most important thing; Training at a time that works for you.
 
It is easier for a lot of people to skip workouts later in the day and so working out in the morning does often work very well for a lot of people, 
but physiologically that doesn't make it ideal. 
And it doesn't have to be
 immediately
 upon waking either, just enough time to get it done before you get into a lot of cognitive loading work that might later hinder your ability to desire to go to the gym in the first place. It's the same reason productivity gurus tell you to get your most cognitive tasks out of the way early in the day. 
 
Actually there may actually be some inherent risks to training within the first 3 hours of waking, particularly if you are say lifting weight or doing explosive work. Less so for endurance/aerobic training.
 
From sleeping all night (horizontal position), the fluid in your spine actually displaces, slightly destabilizing your spine for the first part of the day. This might be associated with injury potential (at least for heavily loaded movements involving the spine). Not only that but nervous system function, muscular blood flow, glucose metabolism and joint mobility at this time of day aren't really that conducive to training.  All of them are limited first in the morning, which is why most world records in sports are not broken first thing in the morning, they are generally broken in early evening.
 
You'd be hard pressed to find many strength or power athletes that successfully do the bulk of their training early in the morning (
some will start at 10-11 AM
). There may be some early morning skates, serving practice or shooting practice, but these are usually low intensity and/or optimized to suit the schedules of student-athletes and break up the training day (
for twice-a-day training purposes
).
 
This generally doesn't apply as heavily to the endurance athletes, who often have early start times to deal with mid-afternoon heat, but they would probably still perform better if it was done in the early evening (
it would just be hotter out still in many climates
). 
 
Again schedules optimized to the person and the objective, not necessarily the physiological optimized times.
 
A physiologically optimized (i.e. derive the most benefit from for performance purposes and anabolism) training window for most people (
depending on their circadian rhythm
) is probably anywhere from about 2:30-3 PM in the afternoon (
just after your circadian dip
) to about 6:30-7 PM at night. 
 
Yes peak circadian rhythm in most people is closer to 8, which is when you might be inclined or think to be ideal. However, training late generally makes it difficult to fall asleep for 2-3 hours post-workout due to hormone fluctuations, so the later in the day you push it the longer you might end staying up. I used to have volleyball practice from 9-11PM in school, and I could never fall asleep before 1AM as a result, which wrecked havoc on my school schedule.
 
Again, here 
I am
 speaking from a fairly pure physiological point of view, if you can't do that, or it impedes you from actually training, you're better off doing what makes you the most consistent. The differences are probably physiologically negligible (I'm throwing out a guess of less than 10-15% difference) long-term, except training first thing in the morning is actually pretty terrible for performance purposes (
which isn't necessarily the same as training...
). It would also probably increase training injury risk slightly for weight training/explosive training. 
 
It would on the other hand make sense if you competed early in the morning, to move your training to early in the morning to acclimatize for your performances.
 
Typically if performance is required or the intensity of training is high, wait at least 3 hours, and maybe even preferably six if you can. If it's just aerobic exercise, endurance, then do it whenever is convenient.
 
There are other influencers too. For instance if you have a high stress, high cognitive load job (lawyer, doctor, entrepreneur, technician, engineer, etc...) then you might be more likely to skip training the later in the day you leave it. If you have a lower cognitive load job (autopilot repetitive tasks, manual labour, factory work, etc...) then you might have the mental reserve to better tolerate training later in the day.
 
Ultimately, the best time to work out during the day depends on you.

title: Are there any poor people on Quora, as Internet access is very cheap nowadays?
article:
There are lots of poor people on Quora. Lots and lots of them, literally from every country around the world.
 
By American, Canadian or British standards I am poor, but by living standards in other countries such as India or Pakistan I am wealthy. It’s all relative.
 
By Brazilian standards, which is where I live, I am… let’s put it this way… very comfortable.
 
Internet service at home costs me R$147.00 (US$30.00) a month. That’s for a velocity of over 700 megabytes per second, which is really fast, and there’s no limit to how much I can upload or download.
 
But for many Brazilians, that’s really expen
Continue Reading
There are lots of poor people on Quora. Lots and lots of them, literally from every country around the world.
 
By American, Canadian or British standards I am poor, but by living standards in other countries such as India or Pakistan I am wealthy. It’s all relative.
 
By Brazilian standards, which is where I live, I am… let’s put it this way… very comfortable.
 
Internet service at home costs me R$147.00 (US$30.00) a month. That’s for a velocity of over 700 megabytes per second, which is really fast, and there’s no limit to how much I can upload or download.
 
But for many Brazilians, that’s really expensive, it’s 10% of their monthly salary for 2/3 of the population. So for the majority of the country internet access isn’t cheap.
 
Internet service on my phone is R$60.00 (US$12.00) a month. It gives me 22 gigabytes of 4g before my connection speed is reduced to 32k, which works well for text emailing, but that’s about it.
 
This price also gives me unlimited calling and unlimited text messages to any landline or cellular phone in Brazil independent of who their or my cellular provider is.
 
It’s accompanied with free inter-state roaming, and because it’s a pre-paid plan it’s not linked to the purchase of a phone, so really, it’s not a bad deal.
 
Yet, that still means that a family of four, with both parents working minimum wage jobs, as over 1/2 the country does, is paying R$387.00 (US$78.00) a month for internet and cellular services.
 
When a family makes R$2500.00 (US$500.00) a month, that’s close to 18% of their income, that’s a lot.
 
Now add in the cost of the phones, which are often financed for two years at interest rates of 10% a month which is 420% a year, yes, you read that right, 420%.
 
Borrowing money in Brazil is comparable to borrowing money from the mafia in other countries, yet so many people do it, because they want an internet connection.
 
And add in the cost of things like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney and Apple+ on family plans, which aren’t expensive in Brazil, all four cost R$75.00 (US$15.00) a month, much less than in many other countries.
 
Still, it’s easy to see that for many Brazilians access to the internet is expensive, for half the country it literally affects the amount of food you can eat and what neighborhood you can afford to live in.
 
So, yes, there are poor people on Quora, even if internet services in Brazil are 20% of the price they are in the United States.
 
The other answers I have read to this question also say the same thing. For a large percentage of people, the internet isn’t cheap.

article:
While it has been quite entertaining to read these answers, I don’t think Americans on an average are really any less or more ignorant than the average person anywhere else in the world. I think there are some reasons why it may seem so:
 
1. They have a strong passport and a strong currency which does aide them in traveling around the world more easily than many others. You find American travelers everywhere, increasing the chance of encounters with their ignorance.
 
2. Their native language is English, widely recognized. They don’t have the advantage of switching into another language. If they sa
Continue Reading
While it has been quite entertaining to read these answers, I don’t think Americans on an average are really any less or more ignorant than the average person anywhere else in the world. I think there are some reasons why it may seem so:
 
1. They have a strong passport and a strong currency which does aide them in traveling around the world more easily than many others. You find American travelers everywhere, increasing the chance of encounters with their ignorance.
 
2. Their native language is English, widely recognized. They don’t have the advantage of switching into another language. If they say something stupid, most people will know it.
 
3. For the better or worse, US is a hot migrant destination. Making people from other parts of the world better places to spot their ignorance than the other way around.
 
4. Last but not the least I’d say that some of the ignorance does come from a certain arrogance that comes from believing in notions like “the greatest country in the world”.
 
And as though the impression wasn’t enough, they have chosen one of them to grace the White House to make it official.
 
P.S.: Btw, having recently moved here, I too have an ignorant American story.
 
So this happened in the early 2016. I had been here a couple of weeks. A white woman, a complete stranger, said to me, “Really, you’ve been here only five weeks? It doesn’t show!”
 
Her stereotyped Indian cemented my stereotyped American. :-)

title: What is your gym routine?
article:
Indeed, IDEs are sometimes more of a hindrance than a help when you're learning a new programming language. However, this isn't true of CLion, which 
can be very helpful
 right off the bat. Let's run through some of the advantages of using CLion:
 
CLion makes it easy to start a new project. The wizard will generate a simple project structure with stub code that you can explore and run right away.
