title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Year 2003 , I visited a small town in mid-west (in Kansas) . I lived in Germany those days but I was holding Indian Passport. I had traveler's check and wanted to cash in them. My friend lived in the town and he had a bank account so he advised me to go to the same bank with him.
 
I went to teller and the conversation starts

Year 2003 , I visited a small town in mid-west (in Kansas) . I lived in Germany those days but I was holding Indian Passport. I had traveler's check and wanted to cash in them. My friend lived in the town and he had a bank account so he advised me to go to the same bank with him.
 
I went to teller and the conversation starts
 
Teller Guy: do you have account with us Sir,
 
Me : no
 
He: May I see your ID please.
 
Me : I showed my Indian Passport. (I had a DL from Germany but I did not want to show an ID that is not in English)
 
He: Sir I want ID (Shows me his DL)
 
Me: This is Passport and It is also an ID.
 
He looked confused and asked to me go over a desk.
 
A lady was sitting there and I explained the issue. She did not have any idea about passport.
 
She called someone from the desk (She puts the speaker on and I guess in the same office or head office)
 
She: Hey there, here is a gentleman who has Passport for his ID. Do you know what is a passport?
 
Phone Voice: Hmmm, let me check …so Passport , yeah …this is a document that is used for international travel and sometime for domestic travel also. It has signature and photo and yes we can accept as an ID. (It looked like he was referring some notes)
 
She: okay , sounds good
 
Phone Voice: Hey, can you check, which state the passport is issued from !
 
Me: I show the passport to her. Cover page reads “Republic of India” .
 
She reads, It is republic…hmm…Indiana , Yes it is from Indiana
 
Phone Voice: We are good, this is from close by.
 
I did not say any word after that, showed my signature in the passport, signed the travelers check and cashed them in. Got the cash said thank you and just went out.
 
After we went inside the car, my friend and I laughed a loud.

title: What is a good at home workout routine for intermediate beginners?
article:
Before starting, always keep these in mind -
Never skip meals, especially Breakfast.
Some workout is better than none.
Rest Day is equally important as Leg day.
As for the exercises, keep it a mix. Some popular ones you want to start with are Deadlift, Squats, Pull Ups, Bench press, and of course Dumbbells. About 30% of your workout is recommended Cardio. One final piece of advice :
Now get out of your comfort zone and start your workout. Don’t worry about the results. Eventually you will see them. Stay focussed.

article:

Continue Reading
Oh dear my goodness. I have been the most ignorant of us all. In my defense I’ve suffered from severe mental illness most of my adult life so I can relate to not being able to hand back the correct change. You see when we mentally challenged folks are on medication it makes our thinking like molasses finding clarity through thick mud. It is so hard to think when I am on bad drugs.
 
So yes, I’ve held many of these jobs that at bad times in my life render me incapable of them. Please do not blame me. Perhaps blame the fact that besides me being on medication that makes it nearly impossible for me to think but also that machines teach us not to think for ourselves. In pressing in buttons our thinking abilities are rendered inactive thus eventually become muted over time.
 
Technology is rendering us low skilled laborers out of the job market. Its scary and frightening for a whole bunch of people like me who do not have access to education or the ability to think on a level demanding a living wage. Us poor people bear the brunt of blame for our inability to rise out of insurmountable odds against us. We attend elementary schools where the Kindergarten children run around slurring hate speech at the others so the chance for us to learn our ABCs does not arrive. Yet our schools push us onto the first grade ill equipped to handle the challenges that face us there because we never got the ingredients of a calm classroom education.
 
Not only that our parents are in marriages that make our home environment chaotic too. Our parents if both home at the same yell at each other and bicker about money and sex and bargain on how much our father will pay our mother to feed us kids so we can eat that week for how many times she will sleep with him for that money….A little too much information? Perhaps. Keep reading.
 
The challenges that face us poor people render us in these positions in life where we are utterly helpless dependent on others because we never learn the tools on how to escape these situations. We get told to have them. But no one ever teaches how to get out of these bad situations even when we do earn the ability for education because others heap other insurmountable odds onto our plates like illness and physical disability rendering us then unable to attend universities like our peers sail through leading them to jobs that you reading this I imagine perhaps have.
 
Its easy not to see poor people. We are everywhere. We are the checkers at 7-Eleven whose parents did not speak English so we went into Kindergarten not equipped with the language skills our English speaking peers have. It is little wonder when we get passed on through education that our deficiencies don’t measure up to other peers. It is not a fair game we play in life and so when I hear others tell each other how ignorant we can be, I get saddened at the lack of insight that person gives to the checker like me who can’t do simple math. I’ve been a checker. I am a college graduate. I have been a checker after my college graduation. I have been many more things and many less things in my life but ignorant I don’t think is one I am most proud of. So next time we all see a person who can’t do simple math try to think about what that kid’s childhood has been like leading to him or her not being able to count back from $100. It should not insight a superior mentality. It should insight gratitude for the privilege some of us get to attend elementary schools where the kids don’t fight forcing a teacher into behavior management rather than educational inspirer extraordinaire. Be more grateful please and reach out in kindness with an open hand not a closed fist in mindset.

Continue Reading
Many years ago while in college I befriended a foreign student (FS). I witnessed many dialogues in which she was asked stupid questions and was subjected to ignorant comments by fellow students, in each case an ignorant American (IA). Here are some examples:
 
IA: Where are you from?
 
FS: I am from Uruguay.
 
IA: And where is that?
 
FS: It’s in South America.
 
IA: It can’t be. You are white!
 
Then the foreign student would politely explain that she was a descendant of European immigrants, like the vast majority of the people in her country.
 
IA: You have an accent, where are you from?
 
FS: I am from Uruguay.
 
IA: And what language do you speak in your country?
 
FS: We speak Spanish.
 
IA: If you speak Spanish you have to be a Mexican!
 
Then the foreign student would politely explain that Spanish is spoken in many different countries.
 
IA: What is your name?
 
FS: My name is Eva.
 
IA: And where are you from?
 
FS: I am from Uruguay.
 
IA: If your name is Eva you have to be Polish, because my best friend’s name is Eva and she is Polish.
 
Then the foreign student would politely explain that Eva is a common name in many European languages.
 
IA: You have an accent, where are you from?
 
FS: I am from Uruguay.
 
IA: I think you have to be from Finland, because my sister-in-law is from Finland and you sound just like her.
 
Then the foreign student smiled politely but did not answer (or maybe I just don’t remember what she answered).
 
On one occasion, while on a trip to California, we were shopping in a small retail store. The saleswoman addressed her in German, to which she replied that she didn’t understand. The saleswoman then asked her where she was from. After hearing the answer “Uruguay,” the saleswoman said, “But you look German, and you speak with a German accent, you have to be German!” (She was not German, her parents were not German, they did not speak German, and they did not have any German ancestry.)
 
She told me of several other encounters with IAs, which I did not witness.
 
She heard several variations of the comments:
 
“If your name is Eva you have to be German,”
 
“Your name is Eva, you have to be from Sweden.”
 
“How come you are white?”
 
“You don’t look Spanish.”
 
She lamented to me that many times when she answered the question, “Where are you from?” her skin darkened and her IQ lowered in the eyes of the American questioner.
 
In one case, on hearing her accent, a woman told her, “You have dark skin, are you from Egypt?”
 
She also heard, “You look Indian, are you from India?” “You have a Russian accent.” “You have an Italian accent.” “Are you Arabic? You look Arabic to me.” “You have an accent, are you from Turkey?” “I recognize your accent, you must be from Albania.”
 
On one occasion, when asked for the millionth time the “where are you from?” question, she answered, “I am from Betazed.” “And where is that?” the questioner then asked, to which she replied, “In Europe, of course!” And the questioner seemed satisfied.
 
As Dave Barry would say, I am not making this up.

So I was using a treadmill. As I was used to km/hr back in India I changed the setting from miles/hr to km/hr. I was at about 8 KM/hr.
 
Suddenly a girl start using the treadmill beside me, after sometime she interrupted me and asked “excuse me why is that the my treadmill so fast even tough we both are speed 8?”.
 
I explained her that my speed is in KM/hr and her’s in miles/hr. She nodded her head and I thought she understood everything.
 
After sometime she interrupted me again “but basically we are at the same speed so how should it matter if your treadmill is in KM/Hr and mine in Miles/Hr”
 
After so many years I laugh thinking about that incident.

weekends off to rest and its hard to workout everyday so I don’t feel bad if I miss a day .
 
when I train with weights I always just train three days a week . at least 24 hours between rest and I do 5x5 programs and only use barbells.

title: What is a good at home workout routine for intermediate beginners?
article: A good workout routine at home should include a mix of cardiovascular exercises, strength training, and flexibility exercises. Examples of home workouts include bodyweight exercises like push-ups, squats, lunges, and planks, as well as cardio activities like jumping jacks, burpees, and jump rope. Incorporate resistance bands or dumbbells for added intensity. Aim for at least 30 minutes of exercise most days of the week and gradually increase intensity as you progress. Explore my Quora Profile for more home workout ideas and fitness tips.

In September 2011, I was on holiday in Athens with my family and on the 9th of September we went on a bus tour to the Corinth Canal. Also on the bus were a bunch of Americans who were loud and obnoxious all day long. We stayed out of their way so. It wasn’t too bad in the end. However, when we got back to Athens, we were informed by the tour guide that the Twin Towers had been attacked, which of course took the shine off the day.
 
After all the flights were cancelled the Americans were re-directed to our hotel things got a little bit chaotic to say the very least. But, you would think wouldn’t you that these stranded Americans who had just faced one of the biggest tragedies in their recent history would have behaved with grace and dignity? But no, they invaded the hotel and descended on the roof bar that first night and proceeded to get completely shit faced. Then, one of them, a bloke of about 25, stood in the middle of the room and at the top of his voice shouts ‘HEY HONEY, WHERE THE FUCK IN THE WORLD ARE WE?!’ Ignorant, arrogant, and lucky to get out of the room with his face intact. I would have died of embarrassment if he’d been my husband.

Full body workouts are usually performed for following reasons
Little time to spare for workouts

Goal is just to have basic fitness

Continue Reading
That totally depends on your fitness goal
 
Full body workouts are usually performed for following reasons
Little time to spare for workouts
 – Full body is a great way to make sure every muscle group is engaged especially when you have just a day or two in week to workout along with incorporating cardioi.
Goal is just to have basic fitness
 – Again you want to make sure you follow very basic minimal fitness routine, full body is the way to go.
Secondary muscle engagement 
– What I really mean here is a lot of people love to just focus on cardio as their primary workout. However to be effective in cardio one has to develop basic muscle strength (like lower body and core) which could be developed by focusing on full body workout.
Working out 5 days a week usually is done by those
Who wants to focus in isolation on every single individual muscle group in order to make those muscles pop out
In case of an injury – if you have any specific injury its ideal to distribute your workout and perform each exercises slowly. This would prevent any further injury.
For people who are thin and want to put on muscle mass doing strength training in isolation is better than full body work out
Above points are just 
my perspective
. Every body type have different needs. For me, full body work outs work best to burn fat and gain agility. However 5 day workout with focus on different muscle groups each day with combination of cardio kind of helps me with better aesthetics and I feel much more stronger.
 
I usually do combination, if I want to take a break or give rest to my body by not doing tedious strength training workouts, I do full body workouts just to make sure I keep my body and muscles mobile 3 days a week and take rests of the days off.

title: How workout exercises?

Continue Reading
Running on a treadmill is probably my favorite and most fun method when it comes to exercising. It isn't as tiring or grueling on your joints as it is when you're doing runs on varied, uneven, and realistic terrain.
 
I liked going to the gym and rotating between lifting machines like the bicep curl, tricep press, and tricep pushdown when I wanted to blow off steam; but the muscle soreness and stiffness that I got in the inboard side of my elbow (known as the medial epicondyle) was excruciating every time I tried to straighten my arm a day after the workout.
 
As a result, I'd have to go to work the next day with my arms squared off in a stiff, rigid, and 45-degree angle. My arms being bent at the elbow and unable to extend without causing agony. People thought I was playing around, “Look at this dick walking around trying to make chicken sandwiches with his robot arms.”
 
So cardio became my go to. Ah, distinctly I remember, it was in the bleak December, and each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.
 
(Upvote for the Edgar Allan Poe reference? )
 
I went to exercise at L.A Fitness with a gym rat who practically snorted canisters of preworkout and whey protein. And he had a free guest pass, so I said what the hell. I got the heart, kid! I was always at the disadvantage, but I doggedly followed his workout routine despite feeling I was over training my muscles.
 
The days that we were too worn out or didn't have enough time to go through with a full workout, we treated them as cardio days. Immediately, I fell in love with the treadmill.
 
The way Mr.Protein saw it, it was either go home with your mind carrying your agonized and hypertrophic corpse in a body bag, or do cardio until you dropped.
 
So I grew fond of working to a beat, treading on the elastic band that bounced with a slight resistance as it looped under my feet, and seeing the gorgeous female triathletes who seemed to have unparalleled stamina run alongside me.
 
I'd start off getting started at a slow and steady 3.5 MPH and would gradually increase the speed by .2 every minute. Often, I'd swap my playlist to an upbeat and fast BPM playlist to challange myself to what I deemed a speed round.
 
Raised the incline, raised the speed to 6.0 MPH, and raised the resistance. And every twenty seconds, I'd increase the speed by .20
 
Before all this, I was always confused as to why people enjoyed running track or doing seemingly linear sports ike cross-country. But then I tried it for myself in the comfort of a warm gym. It feels like you're running away from it all. Not in a bad way. It feels a bit like you're the last mazerunner burdened with dashing through the labrynth-complex that is life.
 
There's a controlled rhythm and willpower, and most of the time you'll be too focused on keeping your lungs supplied with oxygen for you to think about much else. It's a fascinating workout all-in-all.
 
Cheers,
 
Daniel.
 
Sources :
 
Golfer's elbow - Symptoms and causes

Here’s a fun story. One year in college, I was taking a course in Communications 101. For no specified reason, the professor announces that we’re all going to take a quiz on the names of the US states.
 
“Hell Yeah! This’ll be easy!” I thought. The kid next to me also reveals that this would also be easy for him. We completed our tests, but it turns out we messed up the location of a few states. 48 out of 50. We were both so disappointed, but then the professor addresses the rest of the class.
 
“Did anyone get at least twenty states correct?” he asks. Mine, my seatmate’s, and one other hand is raised.
 
“Ten states?” The professor asked.
 
“Five?”
 
“One?”
 
Most students in the class couldn’t even name the very state we were in.

title: What are the pros and cons of training full-body every day?
article:
Pros:
 
1: Most muscles are being targeted every single day due to the higher frequency.
 
2: Good for beginners and intermediates who don't require a high amount of volume. But the frequency has to lower between 3 to 6 times per week. Also, fatigue management isn't a big issue for beginners.
 
3: Almost none of the sets will be taken to failure and soreness will be minimized to allow training every day which is good for beginners who get demotivated by muscle soreness.
 
4: A good full-body pump post-workout.
Cons:
 
1: Not good for advanced athletes who need high volume to stimulate growth.
 
2: This type of t
Continue Reading
Pros:
 
1: Most muscles are being targeted every single day due to the higher frequency.
 
2: Good for beginners and intermediates who don't require a high amount of volume. But the frequency has to lower between 3 to 6 times per week. Also, fatigue management isn't a big issue for beginners.
 
3: Almost none of the sets will be taken to failure and soreness will be minimized to allow training every day which is good for beginners who get demotivated by muscle soreness.
 
4: A good full-body pump post-workout.
Cons:
 
1: Not good for advanced athletes who need high volume to stimulate growth.
 
2: This type of training contains a large number of exercises. At least 5. There has to be a warmup for each exercise which means a lot of time spent doing warm-up sets. Advanced athletes will also need to include many isolation exercises.
 
3: Even after warm-up, it takes at least 2 sets to get a grasp of the technique and make the most out of an exercise. A higher frequency training means a lower number of sets per session which won’t allow performing more than 2–3 sets for an exercise. This is why advanced athletes train with a lower frequency, less number of exercises, and a higher number of sets per session. Less warmup and more exercise.
 
4: Too much fatigue will accumulate due to training every single day. This might not be a concern for beginners but it will affect advanced athletes. It's better to train full body 3–6 times per week and adjust rest days accordingly.
 
Full-body workouts are undoubtedly effective but doing them every single day is not.
 
Subscribe to 
Brawny King Fitness
 for legit fitness videos.

Let me give you my own explanation. We are all animals on this earth. What do animals do? Animals hunt/forage, eat, sleep, and procreate. That's basically it. That is what our bodies and minds are designed to do. In the past we would have to chase down animals, walk miles for water, and forage for berrys all day. In our modern world, we don't need to hunt or forage for anything. We have to walk 10 steps to the fridge to get a slab of meat. In our modern world, we die of totally different reasons than we did 100 years ago. We are dying primarily by the product of inactivity. We don't move as much as we should.
 
This is a good enough reason for me.

title: How to workout
article:
Best way is to have a routine and I've always built that into my commute so my recommendation is to walk or bike to school.
 
If you want strength then just doing sit ups or push ups in the morning or just before going to bed doesn't take more than 5 minutes - there are not many people that can do push ups or sit ups for more than a minute. Do it every day so it's a routine. I think I was up to 80 push ups at your age doing just that, then I got bored.

title: What is the best workout routine to follow?
article:
I don't have a gym membership, so all the working out I do is at my house and at the local park. I have 2 varying work outs that I do depending what my goals are.
Run 3.2 miles with minor breaks between if my only goal is to drop weighr.
Run .75 miles, do 5 pull ups, bear crawl 40 meters, do 10 pushups with my feet inclined, do 10 burpees with a push ups, do a 40 meter wind sprint, repeat 5 times. That is if I want definition.

This was early in my medical school days, I was in my second year and the year was 1985.
 
I was schooling in the Peoples republic of Bulgaria.
 
So I went on holidays back to Nigeria. There I bought a lovely English language textbook of Anatomy. To aide my study since I had just learned Bulgarian. Chamberlain text of Anatomy I think it was called.
 
Passed via London to do some shopping before heading back to Sofia. Landed at Gatwick.
 
Sitting on the Gatwick express train for London. I was reading from the book when I was noticed by a group of middle aged Americans. It became clear that I was the item of their attention and discussion. Then a lady from their group stretched over and asked me.
 
Lady : Excuse me, are you a medical student?
 
I: Yes I am.
 
Whole group in unison : Really!
 
Lady: Where do you school?
 
I: Bulgaria.
 
Whole group in unison : R E A L L Y !!
 
Lady: Is that not behind the iron curtain?
 
I: Yes it is in the South eastern Europe.
 
Lady: Well I never.
 
To be honest I was pretty much offended. What is so special about a dark skinned boy reading an anatomy book in London that should attract their attention?
 
Did they feel there are no medical schools in eastern Europe?
 
Or is an educated dark skinned guy so rare where they come from?
 
As a redeeming Grace for the U.S.
 
Stayed at Sheraton Heathrow hotel ( as I was flying out of there and they had free bus rides to London central )
 
Met a lovely couple with their daughter and son at the pool. He was with the U.S. military and attached to their Embassy in the USSR. They had been there a few years.
 
We had very educated conversation over dinner. They invited me
 
The conversation was in Russian ( My mother tongue )
 
They were probably the most down to earth and educated Americans I ever met.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
A great home workout you can do is called PLP. I would suggest doing this every other day instead of everyday.
 
P - Pushup - As you progress you can start experimenting with different types; Feet up on a bench, diamond, clap, etc.
 
L - Lunges - As you progress you can start adding weight. If you have dumbbells you can hold them in your hands. If you don't have dumbbells just pick-up heavy stuff with handles (4L milk jug filled with water, rocks or sand)

A great home workout you can do is called PLP. I would suggest doing this every other day instead of everyday.
 
P - Pushup - As you progress you can start experimenting with different types; Feet up on a bench, diamond, clap, etc.
 
L - Lunges - As you progress you can start adding weight. If you have dumbbells you can hold them in your hands. If you don't have dumbbells just pick-up heavy stuff with handles (4L milk jug filled with water, rocks or sand)
 
P - Pull-ups - You can get a pull-up bar that goes across a door frame for relatively cheap at Walmart. The bar will usually have different handles so you are able to switch between chin-ups, pull-ups and neutral grip pull-ups.
 
Example Rep scheme: Try adding 1 additional rep every time you do this workout.
 
Pull-up - 10 reps
Reverse lunge with no additional weight - 10 reps with each leg
Push-up - 10 reps
 
If you can only do 3 pull-ups at a time break it up. Do 2 pull-ups and rest for 30–60 seconds and repeat until you get to the desired number.
 
Once you start getting into the 30 rep per exercise area change up the exercises and start back at 10.
 
These three exercises are a good place to get started when doing a workout at home. They work most of the primary muscle groups and will give you a good base strength.
 
Here is an article that goes more in-depth :)
 
https://www.t-nation.com/training/plp-the-60-day-challenge

Most of these answers involve the dumbest people in America, and typically revolve around a lack of geographical knowledge. Here’s mine though:
 
So, it wasn’t in America, but it did involve (fellow) Americans.
 
I was in Spain. I was staying with a nice couple I had met during my travels. The three of us went to Penedes, where they produce Cava, to visit wine country. We were on the tour for about an hour. The gal doing the tour was really nice and did an exceptional job. I learned along the way that she spoke 5 languages! At one point toward the end of the tour, she mispronounced some English word, and a couple Americans in the group laughed at her, then pronounced it correctly in a super condescending way. WTF?! I wish she would have finished the tour in Spanish at that point to remind everyone they are in HER country.
 
Maybe not the most ignorant thing ever, but it’s not the first time that I’ve seen Americans give a non-native speaker a hard time, like they’re supposed to be fluent at birth. Pisses me off.

My partner teaches Cultural Diversity to college freshmen. Over the last 10 years she’s run into African American students who’d never even heard of American slavery. Other students in the same class assured her that Africans were happy to be transported (for free!) to the greatest country in the world, so they could work happily alongside all their friends. It wasn’t slavery, it was a lifestyle upgrade!
 
Most of her students have never heard of the Japanese American internment camps of WWII, about 1/3 thought American Indians are extinct (some thought they were invented only for the movies) and nearly all of them KNOW for a fact that Arabs and Muslims mean the same thing - the two words can be used interchangeably.
 
Let’s see. There were those who just assume that Civil War and Civil Rights are the same thing, and that slaves could escape their cruel southern masters by hopping a bus (they’d have to sit in the back of course) before joining MLK to protest - right after Rosa Parks was shot. (No, really)
 
My favorite might be the slaves who escaped from England. Longing to see the Statue of Liberty they steamed into San Francisco Bay, after visiting Hawaii.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I once had a random conversation with a middle aged fellow bus passenger in NEW YORK;
 
Her: You ain't from around here, are ya?
 
Me: Nope, I'm from Israel
 
Her: Never heard of it.
 
(pause, it took me a few seconds)
 
Me: I'm from the capital city Jerusalem.
 
Her: Never heard of it.
 
Me: Well maybe you've heard of Bethlehem
 
Her: Sure, that's where Jesus was born.
 
Me: Well, Jerusalem is a sort of a suburb of Bethlehem.
 
Her: I get that.
 
My thoughts…She probably thinks Jesus's Bethlehem is in Pennsylvania…..

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
Muscle may be different and unrelated to strength in some cases.
 
Strength as an expression of neuromuscular system ability will almost always be best expressed later in the day. Almost all world records for strength/power sports are broken in the late afternoon to early evening (4–8 PM).
 
It takes about 3 hours after waking for full nervous system functioning to kick in. Think of it like a 3-hour computer system reboot.
 
Not to mention your spinal fluids are not in an advantageous position for loading after being horizontal for the morning. So some kind of spinal flossing for morning workouts is al
Continue Reading
Muscle may be different and unrelated to strength in some cases.
 
Strength as an expression of neuromuscular system ability will almost always be best expressed later in the day. Almost all world records for strength/power sports are broken in the late afternoon to early evening (4–8 PM).
 
It takes about 3 hours after waking for full nervous system functioning to kick in. Think of it like a 3-hour computer system reboot.
 
Not to mention your spinal fluids are not in an advantageous position for loading after being horizontal for the morning. So some kind of spinal flossing for morning workouts is always a good idea.
 
All that being said, the time you can actually train will always work better than the time you can’t.
 
Just because late afternoon/early evening is the ideal time to express strength as a quality, doesn’t mean a thing if you can’t and don’t train at that time because the time is bad for you.
 
Training in the morning gets it out of the way for most people before other aspects of their lives take over and prevent regular training from occurring. Consistency will trump time of day no matter what and many people find morning better for that reason.
 
They may never get as ‘strong’ but rarely is maximum strength really all that important anyway. The average lifter isn’t working towards a world record in anything. For muscle gains, I’m not convinced it matters. You need even more consistency for muscle hypertrophy. I still think you will train better later in the day but that isn’t convenient for a lot of people. So even if you’re 10% stronger at that time, in the grand scheme of things it won’t mean a thing for 95% of the population.
 
Train at the time that is most convenient for you because elite athletes don’t ask questions like this on Quora. They are already training in the late morning and early afternoons twice a day.

Generally this is how my whole week go.
 
Monday to Saturday - Following Diets + Exercise
 
Sunday - Rest + Cheat Day (Cheat Day includes eating 2 slices of pizza or favorite burger or an ice cream kind of).
 
I strictly follow diets for this 6 days. Main thing to avoid - 
Sugar and much Carbs. 
I keep my carb intake as low as possible.
 
This is my plan.
 
Diet -
Morning
Starting with Apple Cider Vinegar Drinks or Green Tea
Followed by Protein Smoothie (Mixture of protein, milk and any high end fruits)
Lunch - Grilled chicken made with Butter plus Broccoli
Post Lunch - Oats or Raw Paneer with Butter Cube
Evening Around 4 to 5 - One Juice without sugar
Pre-workout - Just one apple
Workout time
Post workout - one glass whey protein with little milk and water
Dinner - Chicken with boiled eggs with Green vegetables
I generally keep changing Chicken with Fish and other similar intakes. I also keep changing paneer (cottage cheese) with Peanut Butter Brown Breads and similar. I also make sure I don’t take more than 200–250 gm of total calories while one time eating.
 
Workout -
Monday - Legs Day
Tuesday - Chest Day
Wednesday - Triceps and Biceps
Thursday - Any HIIT or Functional Exercises or Cardio / Spinning
Friday - Back Day (Upper + Lower)
Saturday - Any HIIT or Functional Exercises or Cardio / Spinning
I generally do Abs on alternate day or with the day when I do HIIT. If I miss someday in these 6 days, I also make sure i cover it on Sunday.
 
Remember, what you eat is what you see in your body.
 
Just be consistent and keep doing hard work and you would get that toned body in no time.
 
Sincerely,
 
Aakash (stylemattersbro.com)

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
There are lots of workouts you can do at home. You can create a mini circuit of exercises to target various muscles and also for cardiovascular endurance. Depending on where you are starting on your fitness journey and your current health level will dictate the types of exercises you can perform. Here is a list of some exercises - not an all inclusive list, by any means, but it will at least get you thinking of what can be done at home
 
Inside your home with no equipment:
Planks
Squats / jump squats  
Walking lunges 
Jumping jacks 
Tuck jumps 
Burpees
Step ups - on a stair or chair 
Yoga moves 
Air boxin
Continue Reading
There are lots of workouts you can do at home. You can create a mini circuit of exercises to target various muscles and also for cardiovascular endurance. Depending on where you are starting on your fitness journey and your current health level will dictate the types of exercises you can perform. Here is a list of some exercises - not an all inclusive list, by any means, but it will at least get you thinking of what can be done at home
 
Inside your home with no equipment:
Planks
Squats / jump squats  
Walking lunges 
Jumping jacks 
Tuck jumps 
Burpees
Step ups - on a stair or chair 
Yoga moves 
Air boxing moves (jab, cross jab, upper cut, hook)
Ab exercises 
Kickboxing moves (front kick, side kick, back kick) 
High Kick over a chair  
Bear crawls
Push ups
Spider man push-ups
Mountain climbers  
Inside your home with some equipment 
Jump roping
Medicine ball slams
Medicine ball ab twist 
Ab roller 
Med ball lunges
Med ball squats/jump squats 
Med ball twist / chopper 
In your neighborhood
Sprints up and down your street
Walking high knees 
You can combine any of these to create a workout at home. Do teach for a certain amount of time you feel comfortable with - 30 sec, 45 sec, a minute. Take a short break and move on to the next exercise. Do this for anywhere from 1 to 8 rounds depending on your fitness level.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I’m a nurse. I had a patient come in who was about 32 weeks pregnant because she was having difficulty breathing (turns out she had an asthma exacerbation caused by pneumonia). Her drug test was positive for marijuana, PCP, opiates, heroin, and cocaine. I went to give her a steroid in her IV and she yells at me to stop… she says, “what are you giving me, what is that going to do to my baby?”
 
I would write my answer here, but then I would have all kinds of nurses telling me how horrible and unprofessional I am…

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
I feel like I say this a lot but, it really depends on your goals.
 
For example, if you are going for muscle hypertrophy(making big muscles), then I would recommend you hit each muscle group twice a week.
 
One body part per day will also have muscle and strength gains; plus it will give plenty of time to recover. It just won’t do it as fast as twice per week and maybe that is okay.
 
With questions like this, my biggest concern is sustainability. I will support whatever keeps people active. Programs can always be tweaked later.
 
There is often more than one right way to do something, exercise is no dif

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
One of my many cousins in U.S. asked me over a cup of overly sweetened Starbucks coffee: “Oh, is there a Starbucks in London?” After I replied affirmatively and added about my experience at Starbucks in Cardiff, she further questioned, “Oh you mean there's Starbucks all over UK?”
 
I just continued sipping on the XH i.e. extra hot coffee (which by the way was colder than lukewarm).
 
Edit: She also had larger questions looming over her head like, “Does Toronto have same Starbucks and same coffee menu?”

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I was a graduate student studying mathematics in Rochester, New York. In that place you can buy beer in supermarkets if you are over 21.
 
I was in the local supermarket, buying a 6-pack of beer. The clerk, a young lady, asked me for my ID. I didn’t have my driver’s licence with me, but I had my Canadian passport, so I showed her my passport.
 
She took it, turned it over, puzzled, and asked, “What is this?” She had never seen a passport before.
 
[Edit: After speaking with a manager, I got my beer.]

I went to a MSC cruise from Genova (most passengers were European) and one day two random American ladies sat next to me during lunch time. I quickly engaged in conversation just for fun, mentioning in excitement I lived in Texas. They said they were from Vegas and Salt Lake City. "There are very few of us here huh?" One said. They seemed really friendly, curious, and open for conversation, which is what I love about Americans.
 
They a

I met the most ignorant Americans in my life last month. (But maybe not as bad as a coworker I used to have that thought Trump was the president of all countries).
 
I went to a MSC cruise from Genova (most passengers were European) and one day two random American ladies sat next to me during lunch time. I quickly engaged in conversation just for fun, mentioning in excitement I lived in Texas. They said they were from Vegas and Salt Lake City. "There are very few of us here huh?" One said. They seemed really friendly, curious, and open for conversation, which is what I love about Americans.
 
They asked me where I lived in Texas. I said 4 hours South of San Antonio. "Brownsville?" One asked. I said "yep, around there" that's when things took an interesting turn.
 
"So how is it there with the open border?" One lady asked genuinely concerned. Oh gosh, I knew where this was heading. I looked at her in disbelief. "Uhh.. just like any other city?” I didn't say much as I thought it might be futile explaining I live in a really safe city with high quality of life if they happened to have preconceived opinions about immigrants or border towns.
 
After a little awkward silence I said "I come here with my husband, he's from Netherlands, this is our first time in a European cruise" then my husband arrives almost on cue and sits down with his plate. They take a look at him with their eyes about to pop out and say "I was expecting him to be blonde!" One says shocked. (My husband is more Mediterranean looking -brunette, dark eyes, olive skin, a thick beard). At this point they just start talking to my husband and they mentioned they have visited his country: "Amsterdam and Copenhagen" and I tried not to burst into laughter as my husband explains Copenhagen is in Denmark not Netherlands (and how can you not know this when you visited the freaking country?).
 
Then my brother comes and sits with us (he looks really White) and they look at him confused and ask me, "which one is your husband again?" (I'm guessing in their brain they saw a White man and thought, Oh, he HAS to be the Dutch guy, not this Mediterranean-looking one we were just talking to that says he's from Netherlands! This SURELY has to be a mistake or something!!). 😂😂
 
They were speaking pretty loudly too and I'm sure all the nearby tables were listening and I was just so embarrassed and disappointed and we just left and wished them a safe trip.

title: Is a morning gym workout better than an evening gym workout?
article:
It’s better to work out when you have optimal energy and nutrition for working out.
 
Example - my buddy just recently hit a 300 pound paused bench press for the first time. He did it during our normally scheduled 3PM gym time…after a full day of eating.
 
A week later we were at the gym at 10AM, with only a small breakfast for energy - he couldn’t hit the 300 pounds again when doing touch and go (much easier than pausing at the bottom).
 
He wasn’t any weaker per se, he just hadn’t had enough to eat.
 
So for optimal strength gain you want to work out when you have enough energy to get through your progr
Continue Reading
It’s better to work out when you have optimal energy and nutrition for working out.
 
Example - my buddy just recently hit a 300 pound paused bench press for the first time. He did it during our normally scheduled 3PM gym time…after a full day of eating.
 
A week later we were at the gym at 10AM, with only a small breakfast for energy - he couldn’t hit the 300 pounds again when doing touch and go (much easier than pausing at the bottom).
 
He wasn’t any weaker per se, he just hadn’t had enough to eat.
 
So for optimal strength gain you want to work out when you have enough energy to get through your program, while also having enough food to lift as much weight as your potential allows for (within the parameters of your program, obviously)
 
There is no magical bodily function which necessitates this to be morning or night, it is a function of your own energy levels and what resources your body has access to.
 
Follow me on Instagram for more content and help at 
Joe.Lifts.Bro

Back when the election was in full swing, I was in line at a restaurant and two older women behind me were mourning and moaning the fact that there was not a decent candidate to vote for. They didn't like Trump because of all of antics, and they hated Hillary for being Hillary. They had no idea who to vote for. I was in the same dilemma, but I had already made up my mind to vote Libertarian. I was just about to turn around and suggest that they do the same when one of the ladies stated that she "just wished Sarah Palin would run." 
"Oh, yes!" Said the second woman, "I just love her, and she would make such a great President."
I spun around and just stared at both of them in utter shock. So much so, that they both took note and stepped away from me clutching their purses. 
After a moment, I was able to regain my composure and turn back around, but the whole time I was thinking: "What the hell?" If there was one thing that could possibly have made the last election worse, it was Sarah Palin. Could you imagine her being in the race too? Oh my GOD!!!

Wow! This question has most of the respondents in tunnel vision. I do not take the question as the holy grail of lifting weights, I look at the question as total body proficiency.
 
Weight bearing activity across the board has benefits no question, but the answers given all deal with ego not exercise.
 
One of the best exercise’s is swimming. It takes breathing control, works range of motion, is the perfect complement to weight bearing activity
There are less shearing forces on the joints, less biomechanical facets to consider, and the heart lungs and limbs create an inter muscular environment that’s more complete than just throwing around plate.
 
Most lifters have muscles due to vanity training but are dead out of shape because their mind set is about what the muscle looks like on land and in the eyes of their peers.
 
Bret Cantreras work while noteworthy has not moved the industry forward nor armed the masses with anything but load bearing on a boney hip structures for glutes which can be done way more completely than loading the pelvis when its not even a hinged joint. OH WELL!
 
Squats or squat Lunge combination: There are 4 weight bearing activities that work 33% of all the muscles in the body. 
Squats, Lunges, Power cleans. and dead lifts - thats 33% for each exercise type.
I’ve misplaced the referencing link for researching it your self.. but these exercises use the most proprioception, over the greatest variety of execution and total range in conjunction to plane of motion muscles than pullups than other exercise mentioned in this post.
 
Another huge quality of Squats or squat lunge combination are your bodies pich points where the fluids coursing through your arteries veins and capillaries are momentarily pinched ie pressurized causing blood flow to vascularize and expand all of your internal organs - conditioning them as well..
 
This concept is one of the most missed areas of fitness by so called Gurus, celebrity trainers and fitness researchers of muscle performance.
 
Lastly I see Plyometrics and Par Kour as a tie for the third best exercise..
Neither require you to be a weight head who only see fitness as skin deep..
 
Par Kour requires an ever evolving skill and no matter what level you achieve it will give you a work out because of the direct changes your body is forced to adapt just to be able to do the basics.. and if ...

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I have met quite a few americans and some became friends. There are two i can honestly say that i was absolutley so lucky to have met them. However, there have been a few i have disliked. The most recent one was very full of both himself and his country. Now, i have no issue with loving your country, hell, i love Britain. But, the issue with this guy is that he would repeatedly mention the independence war and how britain ‘lost’ against them. Once, i can deal with that, but everytime he spoke he would bring it up. He’d always say that “britain used to be ruling over so many colonies and now lo
Continue Reading
I have met quite a few americans and some became friends. There are two i can honestly say that i was absolutley so lucky to have met them. However, there have been a few i have disliked. The most recent one was very full of both himself and his country. Now, i have no issue with loving your country, hell, i love Britain. But, the issue with this guy is that he would repeatedly mention the independence war and how britain ‘lost’ against them. Once, i can deal with that, but everytime he spoke he would bring it up. He’d always say that “britain used to be ruling over so many colonies and now look” or “if britain ever had the chance i bet they would try and rule the world but fail. However, if america wanted to rule the world they could.” Like, excuse me, i wanted to ask how your days was or hang out and have a friendly chat but no. Your bringing up past wars and trashing other countries such as germany, asian countries, the whole lot. I remember he would always say nasty things towards the french saying that they “suck so bad” and that “britain must suck more because they lost to france”. I heard the ‘brits are coming’ repeatedly. I just wanted to have fun but clearly this guy was the sort to only value his opinion and shut out/but in everyone elses if they disagree.
 
At one time, we were speaking over the phone and playing games.
 
I have never wanted to punch a prick so much. I was speaking to my younger brother whilst he started playing this loud video over the phone, i had to lower the volume considerably because it was some guy spouting nonsense about america being the greatest etc. After he realised i wasn’t paying attention to the video he started playing it a second time. I ignored him again and he asked “did you hear that?” and i replied “no, it was too loud and i was speaking to my brother so i turned you all the way down.” he got quite agitated at that. If verbally abusing other countries wasn’t enough, he also started being sexist, racist and harshly talking to me about anyone who wasn’t straight such as “f****** lesbians” as he put it. I told him to stop, i didn’t like what he was saying one bit. He told me to calm down and that he was only ‘joking’. Im sorry, but everything that came out of his mouth was not funny at all. At the time i had another american friend from texas, he was a great laugh and would say offensive things but to me they were funny. He’d commonly say ‘filthy brit’ and id quickly reply with ‘filthy american’. There was definately a difference between the two. Even my younger brother, who had never spoke to him (only heard him) was sick of the nasty american.
 
Its one thing to be patriotic but to verbally abuse every other country, race or sexuality is another. I had had enough, so i stopped replying/speaking to him. I just wanted to have some fun and a nice chat, but instead i got an earful of how shit my country is as well as other countries and absolutely terrible things to do with race, gender, sex and women
 
I felt mean ignoring him but he was not the kind of person i wanted to be friends with…

Continue Reading
Hey there! Sandwiches are one of the best things ever, right? They’re quick, easy, and you can pack them with all kinds of delicious and nutritious ingredients. But what’s the 
best
 sandwich ingredient? Well, that depends on what you’re looking for—flavor, health, or just pure yumminess. Instead of writing about my favorite ingredients, I shared detailed information about sandwiches so you can decide what you want to include in your own creation. Let’s dive into some top picks for building the ultimate sandwich!
1. The Protein Powerhouse
 
Every great sandwich needs a good protein. Protein keeps you full and helps build and repair your muscles. Here are some all-star options:
Grilled Chicken or Turkey:
 Lean and flavorful, these options are perfect for a light, healthy sandwich. Add some mustard or avocado for extra zing!
Eggs:
 Hard-boiled or scrambled, eggs are a classic. They’re rich in protein and vitamins, and they go well with almost anything.
Plant-Based Proteins:
 For veggie lovers, try hummus, tempeh, or even smashed chickpeas. These options are not just healthy but also super satisfying.
2. The Creamy Spread
 
No sandwich is complete without a spread to tie everything together. Choose something that adds flavor without piling on empty calories:
Avocado:
 Creamy, delicious, and full of healthy fats. It’s a great substitute for butter or mayo. Mash it up with a little salt and pepper for a spread you’ll love.
Hummus:
 A fantastic plant-based option that’s rich in protein and fiber. It comes in different flavors, so you can mix things up—roasted red pepper, garlic, or plain.
Greek Yogurt Spread:
 Mix plain Greek yogurt with herbs and spices for a tangy, creamy spread. It’s lower in fat than mayo and tastes amazing.
3. The Crunch Factor
 
You can’t skip the crunch! It’s the texture that makes every bite exciting. Here are some ideas to keep things interesting:
Leafy Greens:
 Romaine lettuce, spinach, or arugula adds freshness and a satisfying crunch. Plus, they’re packed with vitamins and antioxidants.
Thinly Sliced Veggies:
 Cucumber, bell peppers, and carrots are perfect for adding crunch and color. Bonus: they’re super hydrating and low in calories.
Pickles:
 For a tangy twist, add pickles or banana peppers. They give your sandwich a zesty kick!
4. The Cheesy Touch
 
If you’re a cheese lover, this is your time to shine. A little cheese goes a long way to add creaminess and flavor:
Sliced Cheddar or Swiss:
 Classic choices that melt beautifully if you’re making a toasted sandwich.
Feta or Goat Cheese:
 These crumbly cheeses add a tangy, gourmet vibe to your sandwich.
Vegan Cheese:
 There are great plant-based cheese options out there if you’re avoiding dairy.
5. The Secret Ingredient
 
Every sandwich needs that one thing that takes it to the next level. Here are some game-changers:
Pesto:
 Spread a thin layer of pesto for a burst of herby flavor. It’s especially great with chicken or roasted veggies.
Sriracha or Hot Sauce:
 Add a little heat to wake up your taste buds. Just a drizzle will do!
Fruits:
 Yes, fruits! Sliced apples, pears, or even dried cranberries can add a sweet contrast to savory ingredients.
How to Build the Perfect Sandwich
 
Now that you’ve got all these amazing ingredients to choose from, here’s how to put it all together:
Start with a base: whole-grain bread, a wrap, or even a lettuce leaf for a low-carb option.
Add your protein: pick your favorite meat, eggs, or plant-based protein.
Layer on the veggies: the more color, the better!
Spread it out: choose a healthy spread like hummus or avocado.
Finish strong: sprinkle on cheese, nuts, or that secret ingredient to make it truly yours.
The Bottom Line
 
The best sandwich ingredient is the one that makes you excited to eat your meal! Whether you’re in the mood for creamy avocado, crunchy veggies, or flavorful pesto, there are so many ways to create a healthy, delicious sandwich that’s totally your style.
 
So go ahead, get creative, and build a sandwich that’s not just a meal—it’s an experience. Enjoy! 😊

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
I met an American teenage guy on the Internet and the following conversation took place:
 
Me: hello
 
Him: hi
 
Me: how are you doing today?
 
Him: fine thanks.
 
Him: where are you from?
 
Me: West Africa.
 
Him: where is that?
 
Me: Africa
 
Him: Is that a different planet?
 
Me: No, it's a continent
 
Him: what continent is that?
 
Me: Africa
 
Him: where is it located?
 
My little friend didn't know the difference between planet and continent. I was surprised with all the Internet he has, he just couldn't Google it to find out about Africa as a continent.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

A woman and her husband approached a young (early 20s) employee and exclaimed “We've tried every one of these faucets and none of them work! How do we know own if we should buy them if we can't get them to work?!” She was completely serious.
 
Mind you, these faucets were all on a wall with absolutely nothing to catch any water that might come out of them.
 
I think the poor kid who kept a straight face through the entire interaction deservered a raise.

Everyone has a story to tell. Everyone is a writer, some are written in the books and some are confined to hearts.
 
Everyone has a story. It might or might not be a love story. It could be a story of dreams, friendship, hope, survival or even death. And every story is worth telling. But more than that, it’s worth living.
 
People need stories. Stories of love, hope, survival, wisdom and sometimes pain. Maybe you don’t tell them the full truth; maybe you tell them lies. But what is this world? A lie in itself.
 
Not the people but the mind, Not the storm but the silence, Not the answer but the question, Not the result but the reason, I am scared of. Not the real but the dream, Not the moment but the memory, Not the lie but the truth, Not the death but the life, I am scared of.
 
Trust me, your struggle, your fight, will be worth the risk in opening yourself up. Get up. Inhale the air of passion. Start your journey. Grab your dreams. Enjoy your mistakes. Dance to the rhythm of your heartbeats. Smile. Laugh. Love. Live.
 
If two souls are destined to meet, the universe will always find a way to make the connection. Even when you lose all hope, certain bonds cannot be broken. They show us who we were, who we are and who we can become. Amidst everything, nature will always find a way.
 
'There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
 
Behind every smile there is a frown. Behind every frown there is a story.
 
Within that story there was a moment of sadness, but with support from one simple person. We can change their fake smile into a true smile. Helping one another is what keeps others happy and reminds them to still have hope.
 
Life has it's ups and downs. We cannot change the bad things that have happened to someone, but we can change the sadness they have within because of their past.
 
Lend a helping hand because no one should have to face the world alone. With the people in the world coming to join as one.
 
We should start treating one another as brothers and sisters. For if we do we can improve the love in the world.
 
There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
 
Let your smile rise & shine.
 
This is my Life, This is my Story.
 
Yes. I’m a poor guy as far as my financial situation is concerned not with my Attitude or Goals.
 
My name is SURESH, I come from a very poor family background with Big Dreams. We used to live in a small village with a monthly income of Rs. 6,000.
 
My mother who is a tailor who is the only source of our family, she sacrificed her life for the benefit of our family development but things are not going as she used to think. I don’t want to talk about my father, though physically he is there, he is not contributing to our family in any way rather he used to torture my mother every time. He is completely addicted to alcohol. I had a younger brother who is completely deaf and dumb, this has become one more challenging task for our family.
 
As we are not financially capable, no one used to support us, including our relatives. I can’t explain my pain within crispy words. Nowadays, the so-called Vitamin M (money) is the only criteria for anything, you may accept it or you may not accept it.
 
I’ve written IAS examination 3 times in a row but failed to clear it. Twice, I had my mains. But no result. As I’m zero at maths, I was not in a position to take any other bank or SSC examination.
 
Day and night struggles, I’ve had my tears. Things were changed at my home, mother and brother got hospitalized. My father is not caring anything about our family. I came back I’ve taken care of my family.
 
Failure and Impact :
 
Everybody is used to point me, they used to show me as a symbol of failure. I may failed in my IAS examination but I’m not going to fail in my life. I’m a fighter, though I failed in civil services, I learned a lot from the journey. How can a single sheet of examination paper can decide my future? Everybody is Unique, right?
 
No contacts. No relationships. No money.
 
Approaching the Politicians :
 
As I’ve had immense knowledge as far as administration and policy making is concern, I approached few politicians to work as an assistant to them. But got rejected everywhere.
 
Civil Services Mission:
 
I don’t want to mention the institution name but I found it. Things were going on my way. But here comes challenge again, I need to pay Rs.60,000 for my coaching. I had no idea how to pay.
 
Thanks for the Internet. I used to search on the Google for helping hands to support me, actually I’ve sent more than 2500 emails to different NGOs and trusts all over the India, including few persons individually whom I found on Google.
 
I got few positive responses. Fortunately, I got support from them to continue my preparation. I paid the fee and I started working on my mission.
 
Part Time Jobs :
 
I worked in different part time jobs to survive myself. KFC, Big Bazaar, As a Counsellor etc…
 
Struggles and Sorrows:
 
I had only three pairs of dresses. If I want to go for coaching I’ve to wear the one dress for two to three days. I did all the Hard Work can do. My only ambition is to get into the civil services. No other exams.
 
Aiming :
 
So, I aimed big to wage a war against my poverty, I decided to become a Civil Servant, so that I’ll get recognition and fame. At that time, I thought, education was the only solution for me.
 
My Journey :
 
I had no money to go and stay in Hyderabad. So, I’ve written Osmania University Entrance examination for my post graduation on the advice of my English Lecturer, actually my plan is to get shelter and then prepare for my IAS examination. By God’s grace everything went very well. I got good rank and I joined there for my post graduation. (For my preparation only)
 
Ashok Nagar, Hyderabad:
 
I’ve no idea about the civil services examination, so I decided to go for coaching. I’ve had my search for the best coaching institution in Hyderabad, where thousands and lakhs of people are roaming around the Ashok Nagar cross roads in the name of IAS coaching. Actually, it is more than a business and business of business. I’m not in a position to cope up with big institutions where the crowd is so high. Then, I decided to choose the institution with minimum strength
 
Entrepreneurial Journey :
 
Formal education will make you a living but Self-education will make you a Fortune. As the start-up revolution is going in India, I had a question in my mind – why don’t I start myself as an entrepreneur?
 
List of my failures :
 
Civil Services Examination 1st attempt failure
 
Group 1 Examination Failure
 
Civil Services Examination 2nd attempt failure (cleared mains, failed in personality test)
 
Civil Services Examination 3rd attempt failure
 
One Indian Student, Failed to complete the book
 
SipCup advertising company Failed
 
We Adopt foundation failed due to lack of funds.
 
Failed to establish myself as a Personal Assistant to A Politician.
 
Marriage-Money: Realities:
 
As a part of my Journey, I approached few marriage bureaus and even I advertised myself on the Shaadi matrimony, looking for some girl or family who can invest and ready to fuel & fulfil my dreams by supporting through money to establish my dream company.
 
I've approached few, even if the girl is divorced, I'm okay with second match, if she had no kids.
 
😂😹 My madness, the world has no place for Honesty & Loyalty, Money only matters.
 
Approached few, divorced & 3 are elder to me around 32 & 34 ages. Their response: We don't care about story, all we need someone who can take care our luxury needs. That's all.
 
I've approached friends & family members, who never believed in my vision, no support.
 
I've approached my community people, leaders & some of the richest people in my community, no support.
 
I've approached few IAS officers, Commisisoners, NRIs & Politicians, no support.
 
Trying my level best to reach angel investors & venture capitalist via LinkedIn & every other platform, no responses are coming.
 
I gave all my side but it didn’t gave me nothing beside. I gave all my efforts and it gave me nothing as a report. Of course success will hug in private and failure will slap in public. But neither happened to me.
 
I tried… cried… dried… all myself !!!8
 
Now???
 
Now, I’m no longer in a position to write any examination or no longer want to work under someone. I want to become a self-made entrepreneur in any way. I’m not going to give up on my dreams.
 
“If the plan is not working, change the plan but not the Goals”.
 
“Body has it’s limitations but mind doesn’t “
 
Your Help is Needed :
 
I'm just trying to express my experiences to get some assistance from the Quora community,if possible.
 
I would love to welcome your suggestions or advices or help or criticism in any way.
 
I may not be the perfect guy to answer you but I can feel and express my opinion by stepping into your shoes in a perfect way.
 
I’m not giving up rather I’m challenging myself to get what I want. I’ll persist until I succeed. For me, the true happiness always lies in Fighting.
 
Disclaimer:
 
All these are based on my personal experiences only.
 
I’m not promoting or marketing myself as a good person
 
Absolutely, I can openly say 97.75% I’m not a good guy
 
I’m not a perfect guy, I’ll never. My Life is always under construction with your help, mostly with your criticism.
 
I may not be the perfect guy to answer you or advice you but I can feel and express my feelings by stepping into your shoes in a perfect way in my own way. Please do correct me if I’m wrong because I’m not perfect. I’d love to welcome your criticism rather appreciations because it really helps to move forward with Growth and Development in every aspect of my Life.
 
Now, I’m running and looking forward to find some investment and cofounder as well for my Brand Boss Media, an Influencer marketing agency.
 
#Never Give Up#
 
#Stay Hungry, Stay Crazy#
 
Thanks For Being Awesome With Your Thoughts And Wisdom With Words,
 
SURESH MADHA !!!

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
1, Push Ups
 
Push-ups work many muscles in your body, including your:
Chest
Arms
Stomach muscles (abdominals)
Hips‌
Legs
Push-ups are a convenient exercise that you can do anywhere. They don’t need equipment or a gym membership. You can also adjust them to meet your own physical ability or to target specific muscles.

Continue Reading
1, Push Ups
 
Push-ups work many muscles in your body, including your:
Chest
Arms
Stomach muscles (abdominals)
Hips‌
Legs
Push-ups are a convenient exercise that you can do anywhere. They don’t need equipment or a gym membership. You can also adjust them to meet your own physical ability or to target specific muscles.
 
How To Do it: To do a push-up you are going to get on the floor on all fours, positioning your hands slightly wider than your shoulders. Don't lock out the elbows; keep them slightly bent. Extend your legs back so you are balanced on your hands and toes, your feet hip-width apart. Once in this position, here is how you will do a push-up.
Contract your abs and tighten your core by pulling your belly button toward your spine.
Inhale as you slowly bend your elbows and lower yourself to the floor, until your elbows are at a 90-degree angle.
Exhale while contracting your chest muscles and pushing back up through your hands, returning to the start position.
2. Glute Bridge
 
A glute bridge is an exercise that can be used to target the gluteal muscles. It is often seen in warm up segments or strength/accessory training segments to increase glute activation, strength, and muscle hypertrophy.
 
How To Do It:
Lie face up on the floor, with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground. Keep your arms at your side with your palms down.
Lift your hips off the ground until your knees, hips and shoulders form a straight line. Squeeze those glutes hard and keep your abs drawn in so you don’t overextend your back during the exercise.
Hold your bridged position for a couple of seconds before easing back down.
3. Toe-touch
 
Strengthen your abdominal muscles with an exercise that combines the toe touch and the crunch and is sometimes referred to as the toe-touch crunch, or the vertical toe touch.The toe touching ab exercise primarily trains your rectus abdominis -- the muscle that makes up your six-pack. Your core, however, includes your side obliques, transverse abdominis, back stabilizers and pelvic floor.
 
How To Do It:
Lie on your back with your palms down by your sides. Bend your knees and bring them toward your torso, then slowly start to straighten your legs. They should ultimately end up perpendicular to the ground.
Lift your arms. While exhaling, slowly roll your shoulders up off the mat, reaching towards your toes. Round your shoulders forward (but keep them down) to create a concave shape with your torso. Your lower back should stay on the ground, but don’t press it into the floor — that’ll flatten the natural curve of your lower back and take you out of the correct position.
Inhale as you lower back down. When you reach the ground, keep the tension in your abs firing. In other words, don’t just relax on the mat. That's one rep.

title: How long will it take to get big if doing full body workouts every day with heavy weights?
article:
Rule of thumb for any trainee.
Don’t try to train 4 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 3 days a week.
Don’t train 5 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 4 days a week.
Etc.
Don’t train more than you need to progress.
Your progress will eventually slow down or halt. You will need to add more training at this point. This is hard if everything is already dialled to 11.
If you go straight from none or light training to too much you will get injured or burned out.

Rule of thumb for any trainee.
Don’t try to train 4 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 3 days a week.
Don’t train 5 days a week unless you are fully adapted to training 4 days a week.
Etc.
Don’t train more than you need to progress.
Your progress will eventually slow down or halt. You will need to add more training at this point. This is hard if everything is already dialled to 11.
If you go straight from none or light training to too much you will get injured or burned out.
For 4–5 years I used to work with a guy who was rather overweight and unfit. Once or twice a year he would decide to get fit and come to me with his training and diet plan. It was invariably extreme with a diet of oatmeal and protein shakes and smoothies, training 6–7 days a week with weights, bootcamp calisthenics, bike riding and running.
 
Every time I would advise him to reconsider. Eat normally, just a little less than usual, train three times a week, start by getting stronger, walk a bit daily. He would nod thoughtfully and go back to his navy seal hell week business.
 
He never ever stuck to his plan longer than two weeks and he is still just as unfit as he ever was, only more overweight. Don’t be like him.

My grandfather's wife once told me “I don't believe in dinosaurs, you know?”. I was so shocked this otherwise very fine lady, who could crack jokes and make my granddad laugh all the time although he was so hard of hearing he was almost deaf, would say something like this. So I tried to let it pass, pretending I didn't care. She went on “yeah, they're not even in the Bible!”
 
I hadn't realized until then what bigotry and unchallenged creationist lobbying could do. I mean, what do these people think? That paleontologists just make these up or something? That they somehow have the time and skills to devise elaborate hoaxes on such a vast scale?
 
Occam's razor would advocate in favor of dinos being legit, I should think. I mean someone even found actual dinosaur feathers preserved in amber, for crying out loud!

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:

I mostly work on claims, complaints (grievances), appeals, training new employees but from time to time, I answer phone calls and do the customer service crap. Just last week, I spoke with an ignorant racist woman. Keep in mind, this woman wasn't calling in from some deep southern state, she was in Nevada. I had to file a complaint. This was less ignorance, and more a funny mistake. I was at a diner in NJ, and it was in the morning - for a Brit, that means tea time (not “tea-time”, tea time [time for tea])
 
I asked for builders tea, and was glad when the guy brought over a kettle. I guess he thought that the tea bag was like a coffee filter, that it would transform water to tea every time.

title: What is a good workout routine at home?
article:
Any good workout routine should have a proper structure to avoid any injuries and to see progress.
 
So, before diving into workouts, ensure your body is ready with a brief warm-up, followed by cardio and other workouts and end it with a cool-down workout.
 
Here’s a sample workout routine you could follow:
 
Warm-Up (5 minutes):
Jumping Jacks
Arm Circle
Leg Swings
March in Place
Cardio (15 minutes):
Jumping Jacks
High Knees
Lunges
Squats
Core workouts (10 minutes):
Plank
Russian Twists
Mountain Climbers
Leg Raises
Cool Down (10 minutes):
Seated Forward Bend
Child's Pose
Cobra Stretch
Quad Stretch
Consult with a healthcar

title: How to workout
article:
To get the results you want from a workout, holding your body in a proper position is just as important as the workout itself. Doing exercises correctly will help you:
 
No matter what moves you're doing, from a push-up to a lunge, try to follow these 10 form guidelines. (If possible, use a full-length mirror to check the position of your body.)
Look out at eye level or above to spare your neck and keep you from rolling your shoulders forward.
Keep your face relaxed and tension free.
Relax your shoulders and lift up your chest.
Pretend the top of your head is being pulled up by a string to elongate y
Continue Reading
To get the results you want from a workout, holding your body in a proper position is just as important as the workout itself. Doing exercises correctly will help you:
 
No matter what moves you're doing, from a push-up to a lunge, try to follow these 10 form guidelines. (If possible, use a full-length mirror to check the position of your body.)
Look out at eye level or above to spare your neck and keep you from rolling your shoulders forward.
Keep your face relaxed and tension free.
Relax your shoulders and lift up your chest.
Pretend the top of your head is being pulled up by a string to elongate your spine and keep you from rolling forward.
Count the reps for each exercise out loud; counting helps you remember to breathe continuously. (Many people hold their breath while doing strength training.)
Keep your abs tight to support your lower back. (Practice sucking in every time you enter a car, bus, train, plane, elevator, escalator, everywhere—that way, it becomes automatic.)
Keep your knees slightly bent, so you don't lock them.
Make sure you can (if you want to) always see your hands when doing shoulder exercises.
Keep moving in between exercises to keep your heart rate up, or move directly to the next exercise. If you can't hold a conversation, you're exercising too hard. If you can talk a blue streak, you may not be going hard enough.
As you get fitter, go longer rather than harder with cardio exercises and stronger with weight exercises—that is, do more repetitions. But it's more important to follow perfect form and do fewer reps than to do a lot of repetitions with form that's sloppier than spaghetti in a high chair.

So this happened when I was in fourth standard, me and my parents were vacationing in 
Jim Corbett National Park.
 
Its a famous tourist attraction among wildlife enthusiast and famous of Tiger and elephant sighting, although i never had the fortune or misfortune of sighting a tiger myself, but forest itself it pretty beautiful. Since the majestic tiger is not easy to come by so near by resort and forest guesthouses arrange small events and gatherings for the guests to keep things interesting and fun. At one such barbecue I happen to come in contact with this rather friendly Amarican lady who was seated on the table next to us along with one of her Aussie friend, perhaps they met at the resort or otherwise, anyways after a courteous head nod she started taking to me, she was an elementary school teacher(ironical) and was teaching children my age back in US, so furthering the tradition small talk I happening to ask he about her visit and whether or not she saw the tiger?
 
Her answer was not something I expected. She told me that she was rather disappointed with Corbett as she wasn't interested in seen tigers, as she can see them at the zoo any time she wanted. 
She wanted to see Indian tree dwellers, apparently someone in her friend circle bragged about how she met people who live in trees and hop from one tree to another like a monkey, hence she decided to come to India to see people living on trees herself and she haven't found them yet
. I didn't know how to respond to that, may be she was joking, but making a joke like that in front of a fourth grader didn't made any sense at all. In all honesty it threw me off!! I was visibly offended and all I could manage to say was that we live in houses and not on trees.

When I was in the states visiting my family (I live in Singapore) I met a woman at a “Chinese restaurant” who we will call Jane. Jane was very friendly. Eventually she looked at me and said,
 
“Your accent is a little weird, where are you from?”
 
“I’m from Indonesia, but I live in Singapore”
 
“Isn’t that in China?”
 
“No, it’s further south, like on the southern tip of Malaysia”
 
“Wait, so are you Asian?”
 
“Well technically yes”
 
“Oh! Why don’t you have Asian eyes? Are you sure you aren’t Mexican?”
 
After spending some time trying to explain that China, Japan and Korea aren’t the only countries in Asia, and that Asia itself isn’t a country, she started asking me other questions like “Why is Africa such a big country?”
Another time I was talking with my cousin (living in America) and I remember him saying something like “China, Japan, Korea whatever! They’re all the same anyway! They eat the same food, speak the same language and look the same!”
 
I turned to him and said “What about Canadians and Americans? You guys look the same, speak the same language and sound the same”
 
“How dare you! We are very different blah blah blah…” I stopped listening and just pretended to agree with everything he said. He also didn’t believe me when he found out that I was Asian and was very convinced that I was African.
 
Yeah…

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
Depends on what you mean by “met”.
 
I’ve “met” people on the Internet who were horribly ignorant. Some of these “trolls” I’ve had arguments with on various websites seem to know nothing about history, economics, morality, politics… Some people don’t know who started or won the American Civil War. Others know nothing about the World Wars or the period after that. Etc.
 
I’ve grown up with people who were three inches away from full-blown retarded. A whole school year, or two or three, could pass and they would learn nothing. They were promoted solely for social reasons.

title: Who was the most ignorant American you have ever met?
article:
